analyzed: dge slong gang gzhan la bstan pa'i sbyor bas bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan par ston par 'dod cing 'di skad ces dge slong gang gis lha dag mthong ba de yod do zhes kyang zer la /
translated: If a monk, through the application of revealing to others, wishes to reveal himself as possessing the higher qualities of a human being and says, “There is a monk who has seen the gods,”

original: rnam pa de lta bu gzhan la ston cing sbyor bar byed na rang nyid dang sbyar ba'i bsam pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu gzhan la ston cing sbyor bar byed na rang nyid dang sbyar ba'i bsam pa yod mod kyi /
translated: and if he reveals and applies this to others in that way, then although he has the thought of applying it to himself,

original: 'on kyang gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: nevertheless, he commits a serious offense because he reveals it to others.

original: gal te de yod do zhes gzhan la ston par byed pa la /
analyzed: gal te de yod do zhes gzhan la ston par byed pa la /
translated: If he reveals it to others, saying, “That exists,”

original: bdag nyid la yang nye bar sbyor bar byed na ci de la yang gzhan la ston pa nyid lta bur 'gyur ram snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang nye bar sbyor bar byed na ci de la yang gzhan la ston pa nyid lta bur 'gyur ram snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: and if he also applies it to himself, then would it be like revealing it to others?

original: nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, he says, “It is not applied to himself.”

original: rang la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “To himself” is supplied.

original: gal te gzhan la bstan pas bdag nyid la nye bar sbyor zhing 'dogs par byed na gzhan la ston pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la bstan pas bdag nyid la nye bar sbyor zhing 'dogs par byed na gzhan la ston pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If he teaches others and then applies it to himself, it is not teaching others.

original: 'di skad @150a * //
analyzed: 'di skad @150a * //
translated: This is what is taught:

original: bstan te / gal te dge slong sngar ni dge slong gang lha dag mthong pa de yod do zhes gzhan la ston par byed la /
analyzed: bstan te / gal te dge slong sngar ni dge slong gang lha dag mthong pa de yod do zhes gzhan la ston par byed la /
translated: If a monk first teaches others, saying, “There is a monk who sees gods,”

original: de'i 'og tu ni 'di skad ces de ni nga nyid do zhes bdag nyid la sbyor bar byed na de'i tshe gzhan la bstan pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni 'di skad ces de ni nga nyid do zhes bdag nyid la sbyor bar byed na de'i tshe gzhan la bstan pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: and later applies it to himself, saying, “That is me,” then at that time it is not teaching others.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid la bstan pa nyid do /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid la bstan pa nyid do /
translated: It is teaching oneself.

original: de'i phyir pham pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir pham pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is a defeat.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni 'di skad ces nga nyid do zhes mi smra na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni 'di skad ces nga nyid do zhes mi smra na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the text here says, “If he does not say, ‘That is me.’”

original: ma bsams par bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bsams par bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not teach without thinking” means:

original: ma bsams ma brtags legs par so sor brtag par ma byas par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i yul bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ma bsams ma brtags legs par so sor brtag par ma byas par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i yul bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is not proper to teach the object of the past, future, etc. without first examining it well, without first considering it.

original: ci nas kyang phyis 'jig rten dag yid mi ches par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang phyis 'jig rten dag yid mi ches par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should consider it in such a way that later on, the world will not lose faith.

original: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the defeat of speaking of what is beyond human weal is complete.

original: // / rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa bsdus nas phran chogs kyi skabs ni med pas de'i phyir zhu ba'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa bsdus nas phran chogs kyi skabs ni med pas de'i phyir zhu ba'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: The section on the questions is stated, since the section on the miscellaneous is not included in the analysis.

original: bla ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa go bar byed pa ni ma brjod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bla ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa go bar byed pa ni ma brjod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The defeat of speaking of what is beyond human weal is not unstated.

original: mi'i chos bla ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa'i thob pa yongs su nyams pa de go bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang de ma brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa'i thob pa yongs su nyams pa de go bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang de ma brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: The obtainment of the degeneration of the attainment of the higher quality of a human being is not the non-statement of that which is understood.

original: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the statement of the higher quality of a human being.

original: 'di ltar brjod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod pa kho na'o //
translated: It is just the statement of this.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: bdag ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las nyams pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas thob pa las yongs su nyams pa brjod pa gang yin pa de yang mi'i chos bla ma ma brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las nyams pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas thob pa las yongs su nyams pa brjod pa gang yin pa de yang mi'i chos bla ma ma brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: The statement, “I have degenerated from the four fruits of virtuous endeavor,” and so on, is not the non-statement of the higher quality of a human being.

original: brjod pa kho na yin pas gal te brdzun na ni pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod pa kho na yin pas gal te brdzun na ni pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is just the statement. Therefore, if it is a lie, then one incurs a downfall.

original: gal te ma thob pa las nyams par go bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te ma thob pa las nyams par go bar byed de /
translated: If one makes a statement that is understood as the degeneration of that which has not been obtained,

original: ji ste yon tan khyad par can sod par yid ches par 'dod pas byed na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ste yon tan khyad par can sod par yid ches par 'dod pas byed na de'i tshe /
translated: if one does so with the intention of deceiving others,

original: gzhogs smos kyi skabs kyi sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhogs smos kyi skabs kyi sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: then one commits a serious violation in the context of the partial defeats.

original: 'on te bsam pa drang pos na ni de la nyes pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te bsam pa drang pos na ni de la nyes pa med pa nyid do //
translated: But if it is with an honest intention, then there is no offense.

original: @150b bla ma brjod pa'i 'dun pas ming mthun pa'i don brjod na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i 'dun pa bsam pas de dang ming mthun pa brjod pa sbom po ste /
analyzed: @150b bla ma brjod pa'i 'dun pas ming mthun pa'i don brjod na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i 'dun pa bsam pas de dang ming mthun pa brjod pa sbom po ste /
translated: If one expresses a meaning that is similar to a name with the intention of expressing a name of a superior human, it is a serious transgression.

original: de dang ming 'dra ba ni ming mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ming 'dra ba ni ming mthun pa ste /
translated: A name that is similar to that is a similar name.

original: ming mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: ming mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is a name that is the same.

original: ming mthun pa des ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa ni ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ming mthun pa des ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa ni ming mthun pa'i don brjod pa'o //
translated: Expressing a similar name is expressing a similar meaning.

original: ming mthun pa brjod pa de la mi'i chos bla ma brjod par bya ba'i bsam pas ni sbom po ste /
analyzed: ming mthun pa brjod pa de la mi'i chos bla ma brjod par bya ba'i bsam pas ni sbom po ste /
translated: If one expresses a similar name with the intention of expressing a name of a superior human, it is a serious transgression.

original: dper na bdag ni slob pa ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag ni slob pa ste /
translated: For example, if one says, “I am a learner,”

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa la lo ma gcad pa la sogs pa la slob pa nyid las bsams te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa la lo ma gcad pa la sogs pa la slob pa nyid las bsams te /
translated: thinking of the fact that one is a learner in the vows of individual liberation and so on,

original: bdag ni slob pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig brjod na sbom po'o //
analyzed: bdag ni slob pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig brjod na sbom po'o //
translated: then it is a serious transgression to say, “I am a learner.”

original: bdag ni mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ni mi slob pa ste /
translated: If one says, “I am not a learner,”

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo la sogs pa la don byas shing bslabs zin pa nyid dam /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo la sogs pa la don byas shing bslabs zin pa nyid dam /
translated: The term “and so on” refers to the Sūtra on Individual Liberation and so on.

original: mi sbyor ba nyid las bsams nas bdag ni mi slob pa'o zhes brjod pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbom por sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba nyid las bsams nas bdag ni mi slob pa'o zhes brjod pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbom por sbyar ro //
translated: The term “and so on” refers to the statement “I am not a learner” and so on.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: mi'i chos bla ma dang mi mthun pa'i ming gis mi'i chos bla ma brjod par 'dod pas brjod pa gzhan gyis kyang thos na sbom po'o //
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma dang mi mthun pa'i ming gis mi'i chos bla ma brjod par 'dod pas brjod pa gzhan gyis kyang thos na sbom po'o //
translated: If one wishes to express a higher human quality that is not consistent with the name of the person to whom one is speaking, and one expresses it with a different expression, then if the other person hears it, it is a serious transgression.

original: nor na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nor na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one makes a mistake, it is also so.

original: brjod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa mi bden pa mi'i chos bla ma brjod par bya'o snyam pa las nor te lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gong ma gong ma dag brjod na yang sbom por
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa mi bden pa mi'i chos bla ma brjod par bya'o snyam pa las nor te lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gong ma gong ma dag brjod na yang sbom por
translated: The term “expresses” should be applied. If one wishes to express a higher human quality that is not true, such as the fruit of stream entry, and one makes a mistake and expresses a higher quality, such as the fruit of once-returner, it is a serious transgression.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzhogs smos kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhogs smos kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one expresses it with a different expression, it is also a serious transgression.

original: sgyur cing smra bas mi'i chos bla ma gzhogs smos byed na sbom po'o //
analyzed: sgyur cing smra bas mi'i chos bla ma gzhogs smos byed na sbom po'o //
translated: If one boasts about one's own excellence in human qualities by translating and speaking, it is a grave offense.

original: 'di lta ste dper na ae ma'o khyod kho bo ci 'dra ba de de 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na ae ma'o khyod kho bo ci 'dra ba de de 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like saying, Oh, you will become just like me!

original: kho ba dang khyod dang 'u bu cag 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho ba dang khyod dang 'u bu cag 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will become like this - stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, and arhats.

original: kho bo ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang dgra bcom pa'i bar yang yin no zhes de skad du zer zhes bya ba la sogs pa mthar 'gyur ba'i bla ma gzhogs smos byed la gzhan gyis thos na sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho bo ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang dgra bcom pa'i bar yang yin no zhes de skad du zer zhes bya ba la sogs pa mthar 'gyur ba'i bla ma gzhogs smos byed la gzhan gyis thos na sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one says such things as I am a stream-enterer up to an arhat, and if others hear it, it becomes a grave offense. This is the meaning.

original: yang dag pa phyi ma nyid la de mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang @151a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa phyi ma nyid la de mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang @151a * //
translated: It is not that it does not occur in the latter part of the correct.

original: dag pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
translated: Correct means true.

original: phyi ma zhes bya ba ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: phyi ma zhes bya ba ni tha ma'o //
translated: Latter means final.

original: gang la gzhogs smos kyi tshig phyi ma bden pa yod pa de na yang dag pa'i phyi ma ste /
analyzed: gang la gzhogs smos kyi tshig phyi ma bden pa yod pa de na yang dag pa'i phyi ma ste /
translated: In the case where the later statement is true, the later statement is correct.

original: kho bo ni rgyun du zhugs pa yang ma yin dgra bcom pa'i bar yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kho bo ni rgyun du zhugs pa yang ma yin dgra bcom pa'i bar yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do yang dag pa phyi ma nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do yang dag pa phyi ma nyid do //
translated: That is the thing itself, the later correct statement.

original: la zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i phyi ma nyid do ste /
analyzed: la zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i phyi ma nyid do ste /

original: de la gzhogs smos de mi 'byung ba ma yin te 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzhogs smos de mi 'byung ba ma yin te 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: The later statement is not incorrect, but is correct.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: sngar mi'i chos bla ma yang dag pa ma yin pa smos la phyis ni tshig yang dag pa la zhugs na ;
analyzed: sngar mi'i chos bla ma yang dag pa ma yin pa smos la phyis ni tshig yang dag pa la zhugs na ;
translated: First, the later statement is not true, but later, when one enters into correct speech,

analyzed: bden pa'i don phyi ma la zhugs ba de la mi'i chos bla ma yang gzhogs smos byas pa'i tshig snga ma de gzhogs smos ma byas pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: one enters into the later meaning of truth. In that case, the earlier statement of the later statement is not incorrect, but

original: gzhogs smos byas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhogs smos byas pa kho na ste /
translated: the later statement is correct.

original: 'di ltar byas pa la ma byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa la ma byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this case, there is no non-doing of what has been done.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te dge slong gis sngar mi'i chos bla ma gzhogs smos bya ba'i tshig brjod la phyis ni bden par brjod na de lta na yang gzhogs smos kyi tshig snga ma de gzhogs smos nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin te 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis sngar mi'i chos bla ma gzhogs smos bya ba'i tshig brjod la phyis ni bden par brjod na de lta na yang gzhogs smos kyi tshig snga ma de gzhogs smos nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin te 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If a monk first utters the words of indirect speech and later says what is true, then even in that case, the former words of indirect speech are not not indirect speech, but are just indirect speech.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong 'di skad ces khyim slong mo ster ba'i khyim che ge mo dge slong gang gi yin pa'i dge slong de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong 'di skad ces khyim slong mo ster ba'i khyim che ge mo dge slong gang gi yin pa'i dge slong de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'am /

original: dgra bcom pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i bar yin no //

original: khyim slong mo ster ba'i khyim de su'i yin /
analyzed: khyim slong mo ster ba'i khyim de su'i yin /

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /

original: kho bo'i yin te /
analyzed: kho bo'i yin te /
translated: ‘It is mine.

original: kho bo ni rgyun du zhugs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: kho bo ni rgyun du zhugs pa yang ma yin /
translated: I am not a stream enterer,

original: dgra bcom pa'i bar yang ma yin no zhes mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i bar yang ma yin no zhes mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: up to I am not an arhat.’ What is the offense?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said,

original: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a serious transgression.”

original: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba zhu ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba zhu pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba zhu ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba zhu pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the section on confessing the grounds for defeat in the training on speech.🔽Now, in order to summarize the teachings from the section on the Vinaya on the grounds for defeat in speech,

analyzed: // / da ni smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba 'dul byed kyi skabs nas gsungs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: the text says:🔽The monk who, when asked,

original: bram ze sdig pa'i chos bsal la /

analyzed: btsun pa'i dbang po drug po dag ni shin tu dul ba /

original: sbas pa / bsrungs pa /
analyzed: sbas pa / bsrungs pa /
translated: concealed, guarded,

analyzed: bsgoms pa dag yin no zhes zer bcad mi smra bas dang du len par byed na 'o zhes bya ba @151b smras te /

analyzed: btsun pa ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes zer ba la /

analyzed: dge slong gis cang mi smra bas dang du len par byed na yang sbom po'o //

original: shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni cang mi smra bas zhes bya ba smos te /

original: dang du len pa tsam gyis sbom po kho nar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dang du len pa tsam gyis sbom po kho nar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that by mere acceptance there is only a serious violation.

original: 'o na ci lta zhe na /🔽gzhan gyis de'i don go na des sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci lta zhe na / gzhan gyis de'i don go na des sbom por 'gyur ro //

original: mgon na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mgon na ni nyes byas so //

original: btsun pa gal te dgra bcom pa yin na bdag gi bsod snyoms long shig / khyim du zhugs shig / snyan la 'dug shig / lag chu zed cig / bza' ba dang / sran tshod dang bca' ba long la zo shig / rjes su yi rang bar byos shig / byung shig ces pa la de bzhin du sgrub na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa gal te dgra bcom pa yin na bdag gi bsod snyoms long shig / khyim du zhugs shig / snyan la 'dug shig / lag chu zed cig / bza' ba dang / sran tshod dang bca' ba long la zo shig / rjes su yi rang bar byos shig / byung shig ces pa la de bzhin du sgrub na'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: mdo snga ma las zer ba la zhes bya ba'i rjes dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mdo snga ma las zer ba la zhes bya ba'i rjes dang sbyar te /
translated: If you do as I say, then you are an arhat.🔽If you are an arhat, then take my alms, enter my house, sit on my seat, wash your feet, eat my food, drink my soup, eat my dry goods, rejoice, and leave.🔽If you do as I say, then you are an arhat.

original: btsun pa gal te dgra bcom pa yin na bdag gi bsod snyoms len par byed na sbom po'o //🔽mngon sum du tshig gis go bar byed pa med pas yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir des na sbom po ste /🔽bam par mi @152a * //
analyzed: btsun pa gal te dgra bcom pa yin na bdag gi bsod snyoms len par byed na sbom po'o //🔽mngon sum du tshig gis go bar byed pa med pas yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir des na sbom po ste /🔽bam par mi @152a * //
translated: If you are an arhat, then take my alms, enter my house, sit on my seat, wash your feet, eat my food, drink my soup, eat my dry goods, rejoice,

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du khyim du zhugs shig / ces zer ba la 'dug pa dang / stan la 'dug cig ces zer ba la stan la 'dug pa dang / lag chu zed cig ces zer ba la lag chu zed pa dang / bza' ba dang sran tshod dang /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du khyim du zhugs shig / ces zer ba la 'dug pa dang / stan la 'dug cig ces zer ba la stan la 'dug pa dang / lag chu zed cig ces zer ba la lag chu zed pa dang / bza' ba dang sran tshod dang /
translated: Similarly, if he says, “Enter the house,” and he sits down when told, “Sit on the seat,” and he holds out his hand when told, “Hold out your hand,”

original: bca' ba long la zo shig ces zer ba la len pa dang / za bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bca' ba long la zo shig ces zer ba la len pa dang / za bar byed pa ste /
translated: and he takes and eats when told, “Take and eat the food, the porridge, and the cakes,”

original: long la zhes bya ba ni byin len gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: long la zhes bya ba ni byin len gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: “Take” means “take with the ritual of receiving.”

original: zo shig ces bya ba ni bza' ba dang sran tshod dang bca' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum char dad sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zo shig ces bya ba ni bza' ba dang sran tshod dang bca' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum char dad sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Eat” is to be connected with the three words “food, porridge, and cakes.”

original: de bzhin du rjes su yi rang bar byos shig ces zer ba la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa dang / byung shig ces zer ba la byung na sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su yi rang bar byos shig ces zer ba la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa dang / byung shig ces zer ba la byung na sbom po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, if he says, “Rejoice,” and he rejoices when told, “Go out,” and he goes out when told, “Go out,” it is a serious transgression.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Rejoicing is of two kinds:

original: sems kyis dang tshig gis so //
analyzed: sems kyis dang tshig gis so //
translated: by thought and by speech.

original: de la sems kyis rjes su yi rang na ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyis rjes su yi rang na ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one rejoices with the mind, it is a serious violation.

original: tshig gis na ni pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gis na ni pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one rejoices with words, it is a downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gal te btsun pa dgra bcom pa yin na rjes su yi rang bar byos shig / ces zer ba la cang mi smra bas rjes su yi rang bar byas na ni sbom po ste /
analyzed: gal te btsun pa dgra bcom pa yin na rjes su yi rang bar byos shig / ces zer ba la cang mi smra bas rjes su yi rang bar byas na ni sbom po ste /
translated: If one remains silent when told, “Venerable, if you are an arhat, rejoice,” one rejoices with silence, and it is a serious violation.

original: smra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it lacks the branch of the characteristics of speech.

original: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba 'dul byed dag go zhes bya ba 'dul byed kyi skabs bshad zin to //
analyzed: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba 'dul byed dag go zhes bya ba 'dul byed kyi skabs bshad zin to //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that this is a downfall of a speaker.

original: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba rdzogs so zhes bya ba mi'i chos bla ma smra ba zhes bya ba'i pham par 'gyur ba bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba rdzogs so zhes bya ba mi'i chos bla ma smra ba zhes bya ba'i pham par 'gyur ba bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fourth downfall called “speaking of superhuman qualities” is complete.

original: // / pham par 'gyur ba rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: // / pham par 'gyur ba rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the downfalls,

original: da ni khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the remaining vows of the Saṅgha should be explained, beginning with emission of semen.

original: khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa ni rmi lam na yang srid pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa ni rmi lam na yang srid pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since emission of semen and so on is possible even in dreams,

original: rmi lam na ni med pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni med pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is like a non-existent in a dream.

original: dngos po med pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir med pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir med pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a non-existent because it is like a non-existent thing.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam rdzas su yod pa yin yang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam rdzas su yod pa yin yang de lta mod kyi /
translated: Although a dream exists as a substance,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las shin tu 'das pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam ni med pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las shin tu 'das pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam ni med pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: it is like a non-existent because it is completely beyond worldly convention.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi 'bras bu lus dang ngag rnam par 'gyur ba dang / khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa ni ma byas pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi 'bras bu lus dang ngag rnam par 'gyur ba dang / khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa ni ma byas pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Its result is not produced. The result of a dream should be understood as not produced, such as the transformation of body and speech, the emission of semen, and so on.

original: rmi lam ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dod @152b de ;🔽kha cig ni gnyid dang ldan pa'i sems rmi lam gyi sgrar brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: rmi lam ni rnam pa gnyis su 'dod @152b de ; kha cig ni gnyid dang ldan pa'i sems rmi lam gyi sgrar brjod par 'dod do //
translated: A dream is considered to be of two kinds.🔽Some consider the mind accompanied by sleep to be the term “dream.”

original: kha cig ni sems de'i yul bud med la sogs pa gang yin pa rmi lam gyi sgrar brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems de'i yul bud med la sogs pa gang yin pa rmi lam gyi sgrar brjod par 'dod de /
translated: Some consider the object of that mind, such as a woman, to be the term “dream.”

original: sems de dang bud med la sogs pa yul des gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa gang byas pa de ni ma byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems de dang bud med la sogs pa yul des gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa gang byas pa de ni ma byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that any emission of semen that is done by that mind and by that object, such as a woman, during sleep is not done intentionally.

original: da ni khu ba 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa par bya ste /🔽gang byas na khu ba 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i kha na mtho bar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni khu ba 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa par bya ste / gang byas na khu ba 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i kha na mtho bar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the offense of partial defeat for emitting semen will be explained.🔽If one asks, “What is done so that it becomes the offense of partial defeat for emitting semen? ” then for that reason it is said:

original: phyung ba na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyung ba na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: When it is emitted.

original: khu ba phyung na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽ltung ba gang gi lhag mar dge 'dun gyis gso bar bya ba de ni dge 'dun lhag ma ste /
analyzed: khu ba phyung na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro // ltung ba gang gi lhag mar dge 'dun gyis gso bar bya ba de ni dge 'dun lhag ma ste /
translated: If semen is emitted, there is a partial defeat.🔽That which is a partial defeat of an offense is to be healed by the Saṅgha.

original: de la dge 'dun gyis gso bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sems ji lta bus shen de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun gyis gso bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // sems ji lta bus shen de'i phyir /
translated: That is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha; it is said that it is to be healed by the Saṅgha.

original: deng 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: deng 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one asks, “By what kind of mind? ” then for that reason it is said:🔽By intention.

original: 'byin par 'dun pas yin gyi rgyug pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byin par 'dun pas yin gyi rgyug pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is by the intention to emit, not by the mind of running and so on.

original: rdzas gzhan la yang 'byung ba srid pas gang phyung zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan la yang 'byung ba srid pas gang phyung zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is possible that semen is emitted through other substances, what is emitted?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: rang gi khu ba'o zhes bya ba smas te /
analyzed: rang gi khu ba'o zhes bya ba smas te /
translated: One’s own semen.

original: rang gi khu pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi khu pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is one’s own semen, not another’s.

original: khu ba phyung ba ni mang du yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khu ba phyung ba ni mang du yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: There are many types of emission of semen:

original: gnas nas 'byung ba dang / sbubs su 'ongs pa las 'byung ba dang / dbang po'i mtha' nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas nas 'byung ba dang / sbubs su 'ongs pa las 'byung ba dang / dbang po'i mtha' nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: emission from the site, emission from the womb, and emission from the end of the organ.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba de dag las phyung ba gang la dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba de dag las phyung ba gang la dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, from among those emissions, what is the emission that becomes a partial defeat of the Saṅgha?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: dang po la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dang po la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The first.

original: gnas nas 'byung ba ni dang po ste /
analyzed: gnas nas 'byung ba ni dang po ste /
translated: Emission from the site is the first.

original: phyung ba de la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyung ba de la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the emission from that, is what is meant.

original: lus 'di la khu ba'i gnas su gyur pa logs shig na 'khris pa lta bu med do //
analyzed: lus 'di la khu ba'i gnas su gyur pa logs shig na 'khris pa lta bu med do //
translated: In this body, there is no separate place for semen, like a storehouse.

original: 'on kyang de ni shing ma zho bzhin lus thog dag las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni shing ma zho bzhin lus thog dag las 'byung ste /
translated: However, it arises from the upper part of the body, like the sap of a sugar cane.

original: dper na bu ram shing las khu ba dang 'bru las 'bru mar bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bu ram shing las khu ba dang 'bru las 'bru mar bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like juice from sugarcane and oil from sesame seeds.

original: dang po las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dang po las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The definition of the first is as follows:

original: de myong ba'i gnas skabs de na 'dod chags shas che rab tu 'gyur ba dang / bde ba nyams su myong ba chen po skye ba dang / snying 'dar ba la sogs pa lus 'gyur ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de myong ba'i gnas skabs de na 'dod chags shas che rab tu 'gyur ba dang / bde ba nyams su myong ba chen po skye ba dang / snying 'dar ba la sogs pa lus 'gyur ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: At the time of experiencing it, there is a predominance of attachment, a great experience of pleasure arises, and there is a physical change such as trembling.

original: mdo byed pas de ga las she na nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las te /🔽btsun @153a * //
analyzed: mdo byed pas de ga las she na nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las te / btsun @153a * //
translated: If it is asked, “From where?” it is from the Upāliparipṛcchā:

original: pa ji tsam gyis ni khu ba phyung bar brjod par bgyi /
analyzed: pa ji tsam gyis ni khu ba phyung bar brjod par bgyi /
translated: “Venerable One, at what point is it said that semen is emitted?”

original: gang nas sbubs su 'ongs par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa las so //
analyzed: gang nas sbubs su 'ongs par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa las so //
translated: “When it enters the womb.”

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig las kyang phyung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ni de ma thag tu phyung ba'o zhes rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig las kyang phyung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ni de ma thag tu phyung ba'o zhes rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs te /
translated: The Vyākhyā also says that the words “semen is emitted” in the sūtra are explained in the Vyākhyā as “immediately emitted.”

original: sbubs su 'ongs pa las phyung na ni nyes pa sbom po'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbubs su 'ongs pa las phyung na ni nyes pa sbom po'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one removes it from the womb, it is a serious offense.

original: 'byin par 'dun pa ni rnam pa mang du snang ste /
analyzed: 'byin par 'dun pa ni rnam pa mang du snang ste /
translated: The intention to remove it appears in many forms.

original: la la ni bde ba'i phyir /
analyzed: la la ni bde ba'i phyir /
translated: Some do so for the sake of pleasure.

original: la la ni rig sngags kyi phyir /
analyzed: la la ni rig sngags kyi phyir /
translated: Some do so for the sake of spells.

original: la la ni sa bon gyi phyir /
analyzed: la la ni sa bon gyi phyir /
translated: Some do so for the sake of seeds.

original: la la ni sman gyi phyir /
analyzed: la la ni sman gyi phyir /
translated: Some do so for the sake of medicine.

original: la la ni brtag pa'i phyir 'byin te /
analyzed: la la ni brtag pa'i phyir 'byin te /
translated: Some do so for the sake of examination.

original: de la sogs pa'i rnam pa snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rnam pa snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because these and other forms appear,

original: ci thams cad kha na mtho ba 'dra'am /
analyzed: ci thams cad kha na mtho ba 'dra'am /
translated: is it a downfall for all of them?

original: 'on te bye brag yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag yod ce na /
translated: Or is there a distinction?

original: de'i phyir bde ba dang / rig sngags dang / sa bon dang // sman dang / brtag pa'i phyir de dag la bye brag med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang / rig sngags dang / sa bon dang // sman dang / brtag pa'i phyir de dag la bye brag med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “There is no distinction for the sake of pleasure, spells, seeds, medicine, and examination.”

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra re re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra re re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word “for the sake of” should be applied to each.

original: bde ba dang / rig sngags dang / sa bon dang / sman dang / brtag pa zhes bya ba re rer dbye ba byas la de nas bde ba'i phyir dang / rig sngags kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / rig sngags dang / sa bon dang / sman dang / brtag pa zhes bya ba re rer dbye ba byas la de nas bde ba'i phyir dang / rig sngags kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: Pleasure, mantra, seed, medicine, and examination are each divided, and then one should apply the term “for the sake of pleasure,” “for the sake of mantra,” and so on.

original: de dag gi phyir khu ba 'byin pa la ni ltung ba la bye brag med de /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir khu ba 'byin pa la ni ltung ba la bye brag med de /
translated: There is no distinction in the offense for emitting semen for their sake.

original: thams cad dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all become offenses entailing suspension of the Monastic Law.

original: rnam pa gang gis 'byin pa zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis 'byin pa zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what kind of action does one emit semen?

original: reg pas so zhes bya ba smas te /
analyzed: reg pas so zhes bya ba smas te /
translated: Therefore it says, “by contact.”

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by mere improper attention and so on.

original: phrad pa tsam gyis kyang reg par srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrad pa tsam gyis kyang reg par srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is possible to emit semen by mere contact.

original: reg pa ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: reg pa ji lta bus she na /
translated: By what kind of contact?

original: de'i phyir brtsal bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brtsal bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “by effort.”

original: bya bas drud pa la sogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bya bas drud pa la sogs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is by being drawn by action and so on,

original: phrad pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //

translated: There is no difference in the downfalls if, with a mind of intense desire, one accepts fondling, etc., that is done by someone one should not have sexual relations with.

original: bsten par bya ba zhes smos pa ni bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning la sogs pa spyir bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba zhes smos pa ni bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning la sogs pa spyir bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “someone one should not have sexual relations with” includes women, men, neuters, etc.

original: kun du 'dod @164a * //
analyzed: kun du 'dod @164a * //
translated: With a mind of intense desire,

original: chags pa'i sems med par snying brtse ba la sogs pa'i sems gzhan gyis reg pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chags pa'i sems med par snying brtse ba la sogs pa'i sems gzhan gyis reg pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one touches a woman with a mind free of attachment, with a mind of compassion, and so on.

original: gos kyis bar du chod pa la ni 'og mar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos kyis bar du chod pa la ni 'og mar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is a cloth between them, it is a downfall of the lower classes.

original: gos kyis bar du chod cing bar chad yod na /
analyzed: gos kyis bar du chod cing bar chad yod na /
translated: If there is a cloth between them, and there is an obstruction,🔽then touching the body of a woman and so on is a downfall of the lower classes.

original: bud med la sogs pa'i lus la reg pa ni tshig 'og mar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bud med la sogs pa'i lus la reg pa ni tshig 'og mar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as follows:

original: gang la dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de la ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de la ni sbom po'o //
translated: If it is a case of the actual basis, it is a serious violation.

original: gang la sbom por 'gyur ba de la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang la sbom por 'gyur ba de la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it is a case of a serious violation, it is a minor offense.

original: lus kyis reg pa tshor ba la yang ltung ba la bye brag med do //
analyzed: lus kyis reg pa tshor ba la yang ltung ba la bye brag med do //
translated: There is no difference in the downfalls in the case of touching with the body and in the case of feeling.

original: thams cad du lus kyis reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du lus kyis reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In all cases, there is no touching with the body.

original: bar du chod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bar chad kyis chod pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bar du chod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bar chad kyis chod pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The term “obstruction” means an obstruction that is an interruption.

original: nyes byas kyi na smad pa ni gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes byas kyi na smad pa ni gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A minor offense is not a lesser offense.

original: ji ltar pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa gzhan la ltung ba na smad par gsungs pa la sbom po la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan du rnam bar gzhag pa ltar nyes byas la ni med de /
analyzed: ji ltar pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa gzhan la ltung ba na smad par gsungs pa la sbom po la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan du rnam bar gzhag pa ltar nyes byas la ni med de /
translated: Other downfalls such as the defeating offenses are declared to be reprehensible when they occur in others. But there is no such declaration for the wrong actions.

original: 'di ltar nyes byas lan smad na yang nyes byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyes byas lan smad na yang nyes byas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For if a wrong action is reproached, it is still a wrong action.

original: gzhan nyid ma yin te nyes byas nyid de nyes byas phra mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin te nyes byas nyid de nyes byas phra mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not different from a wrong action, but is a wrong action itself. It is called a minor wrong action.

original: dge slong ma la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not touch a nun.

original: bsam pa'i nyes pa med du zin kyang reg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i nyes pa med du zin kyang reg par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if there is no fault of intention, one should not touch.

original: bud med la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang reg par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bud med la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang reg par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not touch a woman either. The word “touch” is supplied.

original: 'dir yang bsam pa'i nyes pa med du zin kyang bkag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bsam pa'i nyes pa med du zin kyang bkag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, even if there is no fault of intention, it should be understood as prohibited.

original: 'dir gnyi ga la reg na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga la reg na nyes byas so //
translated: If one touches both, there is a wrong action.

original: 'di ltar dge slong ma ni bud med kyi rigs las ma 'das mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong ma ni bud med kyi rigs las ma 'das mod kyi /
translated: For a nun is not beyond the class of women.

original: 'on kyang dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir bsam pa'i nyes pa med na de la reg pa la nyes pa med do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshig logs shig tu smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir bsam pa'i nyes pa med na de la reg pa la nyes pa med do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshig logs shig tu smos so //
translated: In order to dispel doubt, it is stated separately.

original: tshur nyam thag pa bsgral ba'i phyir ni reg par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshur nyam thag pa bsgral ba'i phyir ni reg par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to rescue those who are suffering, one should touch them.

original: bud med la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba spyir sbyar ba'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir mdo 'di bstan to //
analyzed: bud med la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba spyir sbyar ba'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir mdo 'di bstan to //
translated: This sūtra is taught in order to show the exception to the general statement, Do not touch a woman.

original: 'o na 'og nas kyang snying brtse bas sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba la ltung ba med do zhes 'byung bas des kyang dmigs kyis bsal ba mi byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'og nas kyang snying brtse bas sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba la ltung ba med do zhes 'byung bas des kyang dmigs kyis bsal ba mi byed dam zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the following passage also does not make an exception, There is no downfall if one rescues her from suffering out of compassion,

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'og kho na nas ma dang bu mo dang sring mo'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'og kho na nas ma dang bu mo dang sring mo'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: then it is true, but the following passage itself states, Having placed the perception of her as one's mother, daughter, or sister,🔽one should rescue her from suffering by touching her hand or hair.

original: lag pa'am skra dag las so zhes 'byung ba de dag gi yul bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang brtsam mo //
analyzed: lag pa'am skra dag las so zhes 'byung ba de dag gi yul bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang brtsam mo //
translated: This is also stated here in order to show the object of that.

original: tshur zhes bya ba ni @164b chu'i nang du'o //
analyzed: tshur zhes bya ba ni @164b chu'i nang du'o //
translated: “Here” means in the water.

original: nyam thag pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nyam thag pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Distressed” means having attained suffering.

original: de lta bu'i bud med bsgral ba'i phyir ni reg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bud med bsgral ba'i phyir ni reg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of liberating such a woman, one should touch her, is what is meant.

original: ji ltar reg par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar reg par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one touch her?

original: de'i phyir ma dang sring mo dang bu mo'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag sta /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma dang sring mo dang bu mo'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag sta /
translated: Therefore, he says, “having placed the perception of mother, sister, and daughter.”

original: lag pa'am sgra dag las so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lag pa'am sgra dag las so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “From the hand or from the hair.”

original: ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Having placed the perception of mother, etc.,

original: lag pa'am skra dag las reg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lag pa'am skra dag las reg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one should touch her from the hand or from the hair, is what is meant.

original: dran pa rnyed par bya ba'i phyir bye ma bdal ba'i steng du khas sbub tu gzhag go zhes bya ba ni bud med bsgral ba'i phyir dang / dran pa rnyed par bya ba'i phyir bye ma bdal ba'i steng du khas sbub tu gzhag ste /
analyzed: dran pa rnyed par bya ba'i phyir bye ma bdal ba'i steng du khas sbub tu gzhag go zhes bya ba ni bud med bsgral ba'i phyir dang / dran pa rnyed par bya ba'i phyir bye ma bdal ba'i steng du khas sbub tu gzhag ste /
translated: “In order to regain her memory, one should place her face down on a spread of sand,” means that for the sake of liberating the woman and in order to regain her memory, one should place her face down on a spread of sand.

original: de'i tshe na chu zhugs pa 'dzag par 'gyur zhing de zags na dran pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na chu zhugs pa 'dzag par 'gyur zhing de zags na dran pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the water that has entered will flow out, and when it has flowed out, she will regain her mindfulness.

original: khri'u bzhin du bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khri'u bzhin du bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should guard her as if she were a couch.

original: ji ltar khyim pa rnams la bstabs pa'i khri'u dag gis bsrung ba bstan pa de'i phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khyim pa rnams la bstabs pa'i khri'u dag gis bsrung ba bstan pa de'i phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste /
translated: As householders guard a couch that is set up, sitting on one side,

original: rang gi las kyang byed sems kyang gtod de /
analyzed: rang gi las kyang byed sems kyang gtod de /
translated: doing their own work, and directing their thoughts,🔽reciting texts or mentally contemplating, sitting on one side, guarding it;

original: kha don byed pa'am yid la byed pa bskyed cing phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste srung bar byed pa de bzhin du bud med chu las bsgral ba de yang bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha don byed pa'am yid la byed pa bskyed cing phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste srung bar byed pa de bzhin du bud med chu las bsgral ba de yang bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: in the same way, one should guard the woman who has been pulled out of the water.

original: ba lang rdzi'am phyugs rdzi dag la gtad de zan la 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ba lang rdzi'am phyugs rdzi dag la gtad de zan la 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should go to eat after entrusting her to cowherds or shepherds.

original: gal te dge slong de zan la 'gro na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de zan la 'gro na de'i tshe /
translated: If the monk goes to eat,

original: dang por bud med de ba lang rdzi la sogs pa dag la gtad de phyis 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang por bud med de ba lang rdzi la sogs pa dag la gtad de phyis 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: at that time, first entrusting the woman to cowherds and so on, one should go later.

original: gal te re zhig gtod par byed na ni de'i tshe dge slong des yang de nyid du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te re zhig gtod par byed na ni de'i tshe dge slong des yang de nyid du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If he is to be delivered at some point, then at that time the monk should go there again.

original: grong la sogs par bkri ba'i phyir 'bad par bya ste /
analyzed: grong la sogs par bkri ba'i phyir 'bad par bya ste /
translated: He should make an effort to lead her to a village, etc.

original: gal te grong la sogs par bkrir mi nus na de'i tshe gal te bdag nyid dang bud med de stag la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dag las yongs su bsrung bar nus na mtshan mo yang de nyid du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te grong la sogs par bkrir mi nus na de'i tshe gal te bdag nyid dang bud med de stag la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dag las yongs su bsrung bar nus na mtshan mo yang de nyid du gnas par bya'o //
translated: If he is unable to lead her to a village, etc., then at that time, if he is able to protect himself and the woman from the danger of tigers, etc., he should stay there at night.

original: 'tsho ba'am 'on te ma yin zhes yang dang yang du brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'am 'on te ma yin zhes yang dang yang du brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should repeatedly investigate whether she is alive or not.

original: dge slong des don med pa spang ba'i phyir bud med de la 'di 'tsho ba'am 'on te ma yin zhes yang dang yang du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des don med pa spang ba'i phyir bud med de la 'di 'tsho ba'am 'on te ma yin zhes yang dang yang du brtag par bya'o //
translated: In order to avoid uselessness, the monk should repeatedly investigate whether she is alive or not.

original: sems dag pas snying brtse bas bud med 'khyud pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems dag pas snying brtse bas bud med 'khyud pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if he embraces the woman out of a pure mind and compassion.

original: dge slong sems dag pa dge legs kyi sems dang ldan pas snying brtse bas bud med la gal te 'di bdag gis 'khyud pa btang na srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ro snyam pas /
analyzed: dge slong sems dag pa dge legs kyi sems dang ldan pas snying brtse bas bud med la gal te 'di bdag gis 'khyud pa btang na srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ro snyam pas /
translated: A monk with a pure mind, a virtuous mind, a compassionate mind, may embrace a woman, thinking, “If I do not embrace her, she will die.”

original: 'khyud pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'khyud pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in embracing her.

original: @165a * // yang na bud med sems dag pas bu la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyis bdag la zung shig ces zer ba la 'khyud pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: @165a * // yang na bud med sems dag pas bu la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyis bdag la zung shig ces zer ba la 'khyud pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, if a woman with a pure mind, thinking of him as her son or brother, says, “Embrace me,” there is no offense in embracing her.

original: de'i cho ga ni de yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni de yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the rule, not otherwise.

original: de ltar yang sman gyi gzhi dag las /
analyzed: de ltar yang sman gyi gzhi dag las /
translated: In the same way, the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ka tsang ka la la 'khyud pa gnang ngo zhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ka tsang ka la la 'khyud pa gnang ngo zhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: “The Blessed One allowed Kātyāyanāvavaveda to embrace her.”

original: de mdo 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de mdo 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is included in this sūtra.

original: lus kyis reg pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba lus kyis reg pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: lus kyis reg pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba lus kyis reg pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The analysis of the remainder of the Saṅgha-disparaging offense committed by physical contact is complete.

original: // / da ni lus kyis reg pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni lus kyis reg pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the remaining cases of the Saṅgha’s transactions by physical contact, as they occur in the chapter on the Saṅgha’s transactions.

original: 'jam pa dang dro ba dang snyi ba'i bsam pa nyid ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jam pa dang dro ba dang snyi ba'i bsam pa nyid ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The intention of softness, warmth, and suppleness is a serious offense.

original: 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / dro ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / snyi ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis dge slong gis bud med la reg par byed cing 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i ro myong ba'i bsam pas ma yin na sbom po'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / dro ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / snyi ba'i bsam pa nyid kyis dge slong gis bud med la reg par byed cing 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i ro myong ba'i bsam pas ma yin na sbom po'o //
translated: If a monk touches a woman with the intention of softness, the intention of warmth, or the intention of suppleness, but not with the intention of sexual intercourse or the experience of pleasure, it is a serious offense.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: 'jam pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis bud med la reg pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis bud med la reg pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Touching a woman with the intention of softness and so on is a serious offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun ba dge slong gis re zhig 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / dro ba'i bsam pa dang / snyi ba'i bsam pas lus la reg par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun ba dge slong gis re zhig 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / dro ba'i bsam pa dang / snyi ba'i bsam pas lus la reg par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says: “Venerable monks, if a monk touches a woman with the intention of softness, the intention of warmth, and the intention of suppleness, what is the offense?”

original: nyes pa sbom po'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a serious offense.”

original: skabs 'dir zhu ba dang / 'dul byed dag las kun du 'dod chags ba med par bud med dag gi lus la reg pa rnam pa lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir zhu ba dang / 'dul byed dag las kun du 'dod chags ba med par bud med dag gi lus la reg pa rnam pa lnga gsungs te /
translated: In this context, the Vinaya mentions five types of contact with the body of a woman without lust,

original: de ni khyad par can gyi spyod pa dang / khyad par can gyi spyod pa dang 'dra ba dang / rgod bag gis reg pa kho nar bya ba dang / reg pa'i bye brag nyams su myong bar 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod par skye po mang po rdos pa'i dus dag tu dbang med par reg pa gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni khyad par can gyi spyod pa dang / khyad par can gyi spyod pa dang 'dra ba dang / rgod bag gis reg pa kho nar bya ba dang / reg pa'i bye brag nyams su myong bar 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod par skye po mang po rdos pa'i dus dag tu dbang med par reg pa gang yin pa dag go //
translated: but with attachment: contact with a special woman, contact with a woman like a special woman, contact with a woman through frivolity, contact with a woman through desire to experience the difference, and contact with a woman through the force of another when one does not want it.

original: de la re zhig khyad par can gyi spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig khyad par can gyi spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Special contact is of three types:

original: snying brtse ba dang / nye du bshes pa mthong ba dang / sngon kun dga' ba nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang / nye du bshes pa mthong ba dang / sngon kun dga' ba nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: contact through compassion, contact through seeing a relative or friend, and contact through experiencing former affection.

original: khyad par can gyi spyod pa dang 'dra ba ni gnas ma yin par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi spyod pa dang 'dra ba ni gnas ma yin par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Contact like special contact is contact in an improper place.

original: sgyel ba rang nyid ldang nus pa slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgyel ba rang nyid ldang nus pa slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Contact through frivolity is contact with a woman who is lying down, but who can get up by herself.

original: lnga po de dag las reg pa'i bye brag nyams su myong bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: lnga po de dag las reg pa'i bye brag nyams su myong bar 'dod pas /
translated: From among those five, contact is asserted to be the specific experience.

original: rig pa gang yin pa de la 'jam pa dang / dro ba dang / snyi ba'i bsam pa nyid na sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam pa @165b 'di bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa gang yin pa de la 'jam pa dang / dro ba dang / snyi ba'i bsam pa nyid na sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i rnam pa @165b 'di bstan to //
translated: From among those five, the specific type of contact that is asserted to be experience is taught to be the aspect of smoothness, heat, and softness.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ltung ba dang ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir brjod do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ltung ba dang ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir brjod do //
translated: The remaining ones are mentioned in order to teach the downfalls and non-downfalls.

original: snying brtse bas sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying brtse bas sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no downfall if one touches out of compassion in order to relieve suffering.

original: khyad par can gyi spyod pa snying brtse bas reg pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi spyod pa snying brtse bas reg pa ste /
translated: This is the special conduct of touching out of compassion.

original: me dang chu dang g-yangs la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir snying brtse bas bud med la reg pa de la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: me dang chu dang g-yangs la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir snying brtse bas bud med la reg pa de la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no downfall if one touches a woman out of compassion in order to relieve suffering from fire, water, a precipice, and so on.

original: khyad par can gyi spyod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i phyir de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi spyod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i phyir de la ltung ba med do //
translated: This is because it is special conduct and because there is no afflicted mind.

original: ma dang bu mo dang sring mo dag la de dag tu 'du shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma dang bu mo dang sring mo dag la de dag tu 'du shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is when one perceives one’s mother, daughter, or sister as such.”

original: khyad par can gyi spyod pa nye du bshes pa mthong bas reg pa ste /

original: dge slong gis chung ma snga ma gsum po 'thab pa'i mod la dang / 'thab pa'i 'og tu dang / dum pa bcad pa dang / rde'u gsum gtor ba yin la /

translated: If a fully ordained monk reconciles the first three types of wives while they are in the process of fighting and after they have fought, after the section of the house has been divided, and after the three pebbles have been scattered,🔽but before the bell has been rung, then he commits three offenses of wrong conduct.

original: cho ga ma btang ba dang / dril ma bsgrags pa'i bar dag gi sdums byed cing mthun par gyur na nyes byas gsum dang sbom po gcig tu 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis chung ma snga ma gsum po 'thab pa'i mod la dang / 'thab pa'i 'og tu dang / dum pa bcad pa dang / rde'u gsum gtor ba dang / cho ga btang ba yin la /

translated: If one mediates a reconciliation between a married couple who have not performed the rite and have not beaten the drum, then one commits three offenses of wrong conduct and one serious offense.

original: chung ma ma yin par ma bsgrags pa dang / dril ma bsgrags pa dag gi sdums byed cing mthun par gyur na nyes byas gsum dang / sbom po gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung ma ma yin par ma bsgrags pa dang / dril ma bsgrags pa dag gi sdums byed cing mthun par gyur na nyes byas gsum dang / sbom po gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk mediates a reconciliation between a married couple who have not performed the rite and have not beaten the drum, but who have fought, who have fought and then reconciled, who have cut the bundle, who have thrown the three pebbles, and who have performed the rite, then one commits three offenses of wrong conduct and one serious offense.

original: dge slong gis chung ma snga ma gsum po 'thab pa'i mod la dang / 'thab pa'i 'og tu dang / dum pa bcad pa dang / rde'u gsum gtor ba dang / cho ga btang ba dang / chung ma ma yin par bsgrags pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong gis chung ma snga ma gsum po 'thab pa'i mod la dang / 'thab pa'i 'og tu dang / dum pa bcad pa dang / rde'u gsum gtor ba dang / cho ga btang ba dang / chung ma ma yin par bsgrags pa yin la /
translated: If a monk mediates a reconciliation between a married couple who have not performed the rite and have not beaten the drum, but who have fought, who have fought and then reconciled, who have cut the bundle, who have thrown the three pebbles, who have performed the rite, and who have been proclaimed as no longer being a married couple,🔽then one commits three offenses of wrong conduct and two serious offenses.

original: dril ma bsgrags pa dag gi sdums byed cing mthun bar gyur na nyes byas gsum dang // sbom po gsum dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dril ma bsgrags pa dag gi sdums byed cing mthun bar gyur na nyes byas gsum dang // sbom po gsum dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mediates between those who have not rung the bell and they reconcile, there are three offenses of wrong conduct, three serious violations, and one offense entailing suspension.

original: dge slong gis chung ma snga ma gsum po dril bsgrags pa'i bar dag gi sdums byed cing mthun par gyur na nyes byas gsum dang sbom po bzhi dang dge 'dun lhag ma gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gis chung ma snga ma gsum po dril bsgrags pa'i bar dag gi sdums byed cing mthun par gyur na nyes byas gsum dang sbom po bzhi dang dge 'dun lhag ma gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If a fully ordained monk mediates between the three types of wives, up to those who have rung the bell, and they reconcile, there are three offenses of wrong conduct, four serious violations, and two offenses entailing suspension.

original: de ltar na 'dir chung ma dang bo gsum po dag gi yul la tshigs bdun yod ba las /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir chung ma dang bo gsum po dag gi yul la tshigs bdun yod ba las /

original: tshigs gnyis ni sbom po byed pa yin /

analyzed: tshigs drug pa dang bdun pa zhes bya ba @177b gnyis ni dge 'dun lhag ma byed pa yin no //

translated: To act as a matchmaker for a nun, for one who is not a human, for one who is ordained, for one who is not free, for one who is bought, for one who is related, or for one who is engaged is to act as a matchmaker for one who is going somewhere, for one who is coming from somewhere, for one who is being sent, for one who is receiving a letter, for one who is delivering a message, or for one who is engaged.🔽The terms “one who is in the womb” and so on are to be applied to the term “matchmaker.”

analyzed: mngal na gnas pa dag gi smyan byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //

analyzed: mngal na gnas pa dang / med pa dang / nges pa dang / mi bsten pa dang / nyos pa dang / mthun pa dang / bdag ni de dag nyid yin te /
