original: bud med ces zer na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bud med ces zer na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one says, ‘Buy a woman,’ it is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: nyos shig ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: nyos shig ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is to be applied to “buy.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis 'di skad ces bud med nyos shig ces bgyis na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis 'di skad ces bud med nyos shig ces bgyis na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says, “Venerable! If a monk says, ‘Buy a woman,’ what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 'dir ni spyir bud med ces bya ba tsam smras pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir ni spyir bud med ces bya ba tsam smras pa la nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the mere word “woman” is spoken, and there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mdo snga ma 'di zhes bye brag tu bya ba la brten nas smras pas der ni sbom por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mdo snga ma 'di zhes bye brag tu bya ba la brten nas smras pas der ni sbom por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In the former sūtra, the word “woman” is specified, and when it is spoken, it is established as a serious offense.

original: rnyed mod ces bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smras na nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed mod ces bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smras na nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” in the phrase “if one says, ‘I have obtained it,’ also” is added to the end of the phrase “if one says, ‘I have obtained it,’ there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig skyes pas bud med dang lhan cig brda bgyis pa na dge slong da re mchis nas 'di skad ces rnyed mod ces mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig skyes pas bud med dang lhan cig brda bgyis pa na dge slong da re mchis nas 'di skad ces rnyed mod ces mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says, “Venerable, if a man makes a sign with a woman, and a bhikṣu comes and says, ‘I have obtained it,’ what is the offense?”

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽'di ltar gtsug lag las nyes pa sbom por ro zhes tshig kha cig las 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'di ltar gtsug lag las nyes pa sbom por ro zhes tshig kha cig las 'byung mod kyi /
translated: “It is a serious offense.”🔽In this way, in the scriptures, the word “serious” appears in some texts.

original: de ni lung gi yi ger nor ba 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ni lung gi yi ger nor ba 'dra ste /
translated: But it seems to be a mistake in the text of the scriptures.

original: nyes byas su rigs par snang nas /
analyzed: nyes byas su rigs par snang nas /
translated: It seems reasonable that it should be an offense of wrong conduct.

original: slob dpon @179a * //
analyzed: slob dpon @179a * //
translated: The master

original: gyis nyes byas so zhes mdor byas so //
analyzed: gyis nyes byas so zhes mdor byas so //
translated: He said, “It is a minor offense.”

original: smyan byed pa zhu ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba de zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: smyan byed pa zhu ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba de zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The section on requesting match-making is finished.

original: // /'dul byed las gsungs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // /'dul byed las gsungs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize what is said in the Vinaya of the Mūlasarvâstivādins,

original: byin pa las dor byas pa sprad pas ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byin pa las dor byas pa sprad pas ni sbom po'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “If one gives after taking back what was given, it is a serious offense.”

original: sngar byin zin pa nyid la phyis dor byed de /
analyzed: sngar byin zin pa nyid la phyis dor byed de /
translated: After it has already been given, one takes it back.

original: bu mo 'di ngas ma byin no zhes 'da' par byed pa de sprad cing yang sbyin du bcug nas phrad na sbom po'o //
analyzed: bu mo 'di ngas ma byin no zhes 'da' par byed pa de sprad cing yang sbyin du bcug nas phrad na sbom po'o //
translated: “This girl was not given by me,” and one makes her leave. If one gives her again and they meet, it is a serious offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'phags pa khyod bu mo che ge mo la 'di skad ces khyod pha ma dag gis ma btsas pa nyid nas kho bo la byin na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'phags pa khyod bu mo che ge mo la 'di skad ces khyod pha ma dag gis ma btsas pa nyid nas kho bo la byin na /
translated: Here the text says, “Noble one, can you say to such-and-such a girl, ‘Your parents gave you to me before you were born,

original: kho bo las kyi tshogs pas longs spyod dag las yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa de kho bo la yang longs spyod 'byung par 'gyur na kho bo ma btang zhig ces smra nus sam /
analyzed: kho bo las kyi tshogs pas longs spyod dag las yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa de kho bo la yang longs spyod 'byung par 'gyur na kho bo ma btang zhig ces smra nus sam /
translated: and if I, who have fallen from wealth due to the accumulation of karma, were to not keep you, wealth would come to me. Do not leave me’?”

original: des nus so zhes smras nas des song ste /
analyzed: des nus so zhes smras nas des song ste /
translated: The monk said, I can do that. He went and said,

original: smras pa dang / de pha ma'i thad nas bros te de'i drung du song nas de gnyis phrad par gyur pa na dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: smras pa dang / de pha ma'i thad nas bros te de'i drung du song nas de gnyis phrad par gyur pa na dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Come here. She ran away from her parents and went to him. When they met, the monk felt regret. The Blessed One said,

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not a pārājika offense,

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: but a sthūlātyaya offense.

original: chos kyi phung po sngon du btang ste bos pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi phung po sngon du btang ste bos pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase because she was summoned by a Dharma text that was recited first means

original: dge 'dun mchod ston gsol pa la sogs pa chos kyi phung po bsod nams kyi rgyu mtshan gyi phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun mchod ston gsol pa la sogs pa chos kyi phung po bsod nams kyi rgyu mtshan gyi phyir /
translated: that in order to make merit, a Dharma text was recited for the sake of a feast for the Saṅgha, etc.

original: bud med kyis skyes pa la mngag pa'i tshig gis gzhan bos nas des de phrad na sbom po'o //
analyzed: bud med kyis skyes pa la mngag pa'i tshig gis gzhan bos nas des de phrad na sbom po'o //
translated: If a woman is summoned by a man with words of invitation, and he meets with her, it is a sthūlātyaya offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'phags pa khyim bdag che ge mo la 'di skad ces tshur shog shig ces smra nus sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'phags pa khyim bdag che ge mo la 'di skad ces tshur shog shig ces smra nus sam /
translated: Here, the text says, Noble one, can you say to such-and-such a householder, 'Come here'?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽 I can.

original: gal te khyod dge 'dun la mchod ston byed pa lta na nus te der de bod do //
analyzed: gal te khyod dge 'dun la mchod ston byed pa lta na nus te der de bod do //
translated: If you are able to make an offering to the Sangha, then do so.🔽The householder gave him the money, and the monk prepared the offering and sent a message to the householder.

original: des de la rgyu byin pa dang ; dge slong des mchod ston bshams nas khyim bdag de la 'bod pa btang ba dang / de gnyis phrad par gyur nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des de la rgyu byin pa dang ; dge slong des mchod ston bshams nas khyim bdag de la 'bod pa btang ba dang / de gnyis phrad par gyur nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the two met, the monk felt regret, and the Blessed One said:

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “There is a grave offense.”

original: don gzhan dang ldan pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bos na zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gzhan dang ldan pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bos na zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Also, if he has another purpose” means that the word “also” is added because it is a continuation of “if he invites.”

original: chos kyi phung po las gzhan pa'i don ni don gzhan no //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po las gzhan pa'i don ni don gzhan no //
translated: Another purpose is a purpose other than the Dharma basket.

original: don dang ldan pa ni don gzhan dang ldan pa ste /🔽'di ni khyod kyi khyim mo //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa ni don gzhan dang ldan pa ste / 'di ni khyod kyi khyim mo //
translated: Having another purpose is having another purpose.🔽This is your house.

original: 'di ni khyod kyi mi ste /
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi mi ste /
translated: This is your wife.

original: don thams cad la bskyang bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba la sogs @179b pa rgyur byas nas bos te phrad na sbom po'o //
analyzed: don thams cad la bskyang bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba la sogs @179b pa rgyur byas nas bos te phrad na sbom po'o //
translated: Having made this the basis, he says, You must take care of all my affairs, and if they meet, it is a serious offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'phags pa sna chen po la gtogs pa che ge mo la 'di skad ces 'di ni khyod kyi khyim mo //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'phags pa sna chen po la gtogs pa che ge mo la 'di skad ces 'di ni khyod kyi khyim mo //
translated: Here the text is as follows: The noble one says to the great man, This is your house.

original: 'di ni khyod kyi mi ste /
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi mi ste /
translated: This is your wife.

original: don thams cad la bskyang bar bya dgos kyis tshur shog shig ces smra nus sam /
analyzed: don thams cad la bskyang bar bya dgos kyis tshur shog shig ces smra nus sam /
translated: You must take care of all my affairs. Come here.

original: des nus so zhes smras nas song ste smras pa dang / de gnyis phrad par gyur nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des nus so zhes smras nas song ste smras pa dang / de gnyis phrad par gyur nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: If he says, I can do it, and goes and says it, and the two of them meet, and if the monk feels regret, the Blessed One said,

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is a serious offense.

original: gzhan zhes bya bas skyon chags pa med par sems can la bsnun pa yang ma 'phangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya bas skyon chags pa med par sems can la bsnun pa yang ma 'phangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word another means that even if one strikes a sentient being without fault, it is not a case of not throwing.

original: gzhung las ka ba la bsnun pas bsnun par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhung las ka ba la bsnun pas bsnun par mi bya'o //
translated: The text says, One should not strike a worker.

original: gzhan la yang mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i skabs der gzhan la zhes bya ba'i tshig byas pa gang yin pa'i gzhan zhes bya ba'i tshig des skyon chags pa med par zhes bya ba zhe sdang bar gyur pa med par sems can mi la sogs pa la khu tshur
analyzed: gzhan la yang mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i skabs der gzhan la zhes bya ba'i tshig byas pa gang yin pa'i gzhan zhes bya ba'i tshig des skyon chags pa med par zhes bya ba zhe sdang bar gyur pa med par sems can mi la sogs pa la khu tshur
translated: One should not do that to others.🔽In this passage, the word “others” in the phrase “one should not do that to others” refers to sentient beings such as humans, and the phrase “without fault” means without anger.

original: la sogs pas bsnun pa yang ma 'phangs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pas bsnun pa yang ma 'phangs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that striking sentient beings with one’s fist and so on is not reprehensible.

original: 'phangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'phangs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is definitely reprehensible.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: ji ltar shing la sogs pa la bsnun pas bsnun pa las nyes byas su 'gyur ba bzhin du skyon chags pa med pa'i sems kyis sems can la bsnun pas snun par byed pa las kyang nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar shing la sogs pa la bsnun pas bsnun pa las nyes byas su 'gyur ba bzhin du skyon chags pa med pa'i sems kyis sems can la bsnun pas snun par byed pa las kyang nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: Just as striking a tree and so on is reprehensible, striking sentient beings with a mind free of fault is also reprehensible.

original: de yang gzhan la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig nges 'phangs ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig nges 'phangs ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as definitely reprehensible by the phrase “one should not do that to others.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag gis bud med la smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag gis bud med la smras pa /
translated: Here is the text: A householder said to a woman:

original: kho bo la skabs phye shig / des smras pa /
analyzed: kho bo la skabs phye shig / des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: kho mo mi khom mo //
analyzed: kho mo mi khom mo //
translated: “I’m not free.”🔽He said,

original: smras pa khyod dus gang gi tshe khom par 'gyur ba kho bos ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: smras pa khyod dus gang gi tshe khom par 'gyur ba kho bos ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: “How will I know when you are free?”🔽She said,

original: smras pa kho mo'i khyim na dge slong khyim du nye bar 'gro ba yod de /
analyzed: smras pa kho mo'i khyim na dge slong khyim du nye bar 'gro ba yod de /
translated: “In my house there is a monk who comes to the house.

original: des khyod kyi rgyab tu khu tshur snun bar byed pa na'o //
analyzed: des khyod kyi rgyab tu khu tshur snun bar byed pa na'o //
translated: When he hits you on the back with his fist, that will be the time.”

original: de nas dge slong khyim der zhugs pa na de la bud med des smras pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong khyim der zhugs pa na de la bud med des smras pa /
translated: Then the monk entered the house. The woman said to him,

original: 'phags pa khyim bdag che ge mo'i rgyab tu khu tshur bsnun nus sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyim bdag che ge mo'i rgyab tu khu tshur bsnun nus sam /
translated: “Noble one, can you hit the back of a certain householder with your fist?”

original: des nus so zhes smras te /
analyzed: des nus so zhes smras te /
translated: He said, “I can.”

original: de song nas khyim bdag de'i rgyab tu khu tshur bsnun pa dang / des smras pa btsun pa legs so legs so don grub po //
analyzed: de song nas khyim bdag de'i rgyab tu khu tshur bsnun pa dang / des smras pa btsun pa legs so legs so don grub po //
translated: He went and hit the householder on the back with his fist. The householder said, “Venerable, excellent, excellent! Your purpose is accomplished.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: “What is this?”🔽She said,

original: smras pa / brda'o //
analyzed: smras pa / brda'o //
translated: “It’s a sign.”

original: dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monk felt remorse, the Bhagavān said,🔽“There is no offense for one who is using a sign.”

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa @180a * //🔽yin no // smyan byed pa 'dul byed dag go zhes bya ba de 'dul byed kyi skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa @180a * // yin no // smyan byed pa 'dul byed dag go zhes bya ba de 'dul byed kyi skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so //
translated: It is a minor offense.🔽The explanation from the Vinaya on the topic of matchmaking is complete.

original: smyan byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: smyan byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The partial defeat of the Saṅgha for matchmaking has been explained.

original: // / khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the partial defeat of the Saṅgha for building a hut,

original: spyod lam bzhi'i snod ma yin pa nyid la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /🔽spyod lam bzhi po 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'chag pa zhes bya ba'i snod ma yin pa zhes bya ba bzhir mi rung ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi'i snod ma yin pa nyid la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te / spyod lam bzhi po 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'chag pa zhes bya ba'i snod ma yin pa zhes bya ba bzhir mi rung ba'i gnas te /
translated: he says, “There is no offense if it is not suitable for the four modes of behavior.”🔽The four modes of behavior are standing, sitting, lying down, and walking.

original: gnas de lta bu byed du bcug pa la ni nyes pa med de nyes pa'i gzhi med do //
analyzed: gnas de lta bu byed du bcug pa la ni nyes pa med de nyes pa'i gzhi med do //
translated: There is no offense if one causes a hut to be built that is not suitable for these four modes of behavior, that is, that is not suitable as a dwelling.🔽There is no offense means there is no basis for an offense.

original: nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa ni nyes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa ni nyes pa med pa ste /
translated: Not having an offense is being without an offense.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gnas gang du spyod lam rnam bzhi byar mi nus pa byed du bcug pa la ni ltung ba cir yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas gang du spyod lam rnam bzhi byar mi nus pa byed du bcug pa la ni ltung ba cir yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no offense if one is forced to do something in a place where one is unable to perform the four types of action.

original: gnas gang du lus ma btud par 'greng bar mi nus pa'i gnas de ni 'greng ba'i snod ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas gang du lus ma btud par 'greng bar mi nus pa'i gnas de ni 'greng ba'i snod ma yin no //
translated: A place where one is unable to stand without bending one’s body is not a place for standing.

original: de bzhin du gang du rgyar skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug par mi nus pa de ni 'dug pa'i snod ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang du rgyar skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug par mi nus pa de ni 'dug pa'i snod ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, a place where one is unable to sit cross-legged is not a place for sitting.

original: gang du nyal bas mi'i rkang pa brkyang ba la sogs pa byar mi nus pa de ni nyal ba'i snod ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du nyal bas mi'i rkang pa brkyang ba la sogs pa byar mi nus pa de ni nyal ba'i snod ma yin no //
translated: A place where one is unable to lie down with one’s legs extended and so forth is not a place for lying down.

original: gnas gang du gom pa tha mal pa gsum dor ba'i skabs med pa de ni 'chag pa'i snod ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnas gang du gom pa tha mal pa gsum dor ba'i skabs med pa de ni 'chag pa'i snod ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: A place where there is no opportunity to take three normal steps is not a place for walking.

original: phar 'gro ba dang tshur 'gro ba ni 'chag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phar 'gro ba dang tshur 'gro ba ni 'chag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Walking back and forth is called “walking.”

original: 'dir khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma gnyis kyi yan lag ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dir khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma gnyis kyi yan lag ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: Here, these are the branches of the two remaining rules for the Saṅgha in a temple or house:

original: gal te sa gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi dang / shing dang rin la sogs pa yo byad gzhan ngag las btsal ba dang / yan lag bzhi po rung ba nyid dang / rtsod pa med pa nyid dang / brtsam du mi rung ba nyid dang / bstan pa nyid sgrub par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gal te sa gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi dang / shing dang rin la sogs pa yo byad gzhan ngag las btsal ba dang / yan lag bzhi po rung ba nyid dang / rtsod pa med pa nyid dang / brtsam du mi rung ba nyid dang / bstan pa nyid sgrub par mi byed pa dang /
translated: If one searches for other articles such as land, wood, jewels and so on, and if one does not establish the four branches such as suitability, non-disputation, unsuitability for construction, and non-establishment of the doctrine,

original: tshad las lhag par byed na mthar ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad las lhag par byed na mthar ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then in the end one commits a serious offense.

original: sngar ni sgom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar ni sgom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Previously one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yan lag de dag ma tshad ba nyid la ni mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la /
analyzed: yan lag de dag ma tshad ba nyid la ni mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la /
translated: If one does not establish the branches, in the end one commits a serious offense.

original: sngar ni nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar ni nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: Previously one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa thams cad gzhan nas btsal ba yin la /
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa thams cad gzhan nas btsal ba yin la /
translated: if one searches for all articles such as land and so on from others,

original: tshad las kyang lhag par byed cing rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag las kha cig ni sgrub par byed /
analyzed: tshad las kyang lhag par byed cing rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag las kha cig ni sgrub par byed /
translated: and if one constructs beyond the proper size and establishes some of the branches such as suitability and so on,

original: kha cig ni sgrub par mi byed na /
analyzed: kha cig ni sgrub par mi byed na /
translated: and if one does not establish some,

original: mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la sngar ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la sngar ni nyes byas so //
translated: then in the end one commits a serious offense and previously one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin dus gzhi la sogs pa btsal ba @180b yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin dus gzhi la sogs pa btsal ba @180b yin la /
translated: Similarly, if one searches for a site and so on,

original: tshad las lhag par mi byed na rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi po dag sgrub par byed kyang rung sgrub par mi byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshad las lhag par mi byed na rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi po dag sgrub par byed kyang rung sgrub par mi byed kyang rung ste /
translated: but does not exceed the measure, then it is suitable to establish the four branches such as suitability and so on, or it is suitable not to establish them.

original: mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la sngar ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mthar ni sbom por 'gyur la sngar ni nyes byas so //
translated: In the end, it becomes a serious offense, but previously it was a minor offense.

original: tshad las lhag par byed cing yan lag bzhi bo thams cad sgrub par mi byed kyang sa gzhi la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed na yang mthar ni sbom por 'gyur ba la sngar ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshad las lhag par byed cing yan lag bzhi bo thams cad sgrub par mi byed kyang sa gzhi la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed na yang mthar ni sbom por 'gyur ba la sngar ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one exceeds the measure and does not establish all four branches, but does not search for a site and so on, then in the end it becomes a serious offense, but previously it was a minor offense.

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed cing /
translated: If one does not search for a site and so on,

original: tshad las lhag par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: tshad las lhag par yang mi byed la /
translated: but does not exceed the measure,

original: yan lag bzhi po thams cad ni sgrub par mi byed pa 'di la ni 'grel pa byed pa ni mthar yang nyes byas su 'gyur la sngar yang nyes byas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi po thams cad ni sgrub par mi byed pa 'di la ni 'grel pa byed pa ni mthar yang nyes byas su 'gyur la sngar yang nyes byas so zhes zer ro //
translated: and does not establish all four branches, then according to the Subcommentary, it becomes a minor offense in the end, but previously it was a minor offense.

original: gzhan dag ni mthar sbom po kho nar smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mthar sbom po kho nar smra'o //
translated: Others say it becomes a serious offense in the end.

original: de bzhin du sa gzhi la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gzhi la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed la /
translated: Likewise, if one does not search for a site and so on,

original: tshad las lhag par yang mi byed cing /
analyzed: tshad las lhag par yang mi byed cing /
translated: or if one does not build it to the right size,

original: rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag cung zhig sgrub par mi byed ba la yang 'grel ba byed pa'i blos ni mthar yang nyes byas su 'gyur la /🔽sngar yang nyes byas su 'dod do //
analyzed: rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag cung zhig sgrub par mi byed ba la yang 'grel ba byed pa'i blos ni mthar yang nyes byas su 'gyur la / sngar yang nyes byas su 'dod do //
translated: or if one does not fulfill the requirements of proper site and so on, the mind of the author of the commentary would be at fault, even if it is only a minor fault.

original: gzhan dag ni 'dir yang mthar sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dir yang mthar sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Others assert that it is a serious transgression.

original: 'dir gzhud ni dge slong gis khang ba byed du 'jud cing mi rung bar byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽rtsod pa dang bcas pa byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhud ni dge slong gis khang ba byed du 'jud cing mi rung bar byed du 'jug na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro // rtsod pa dang bcas pa byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if a monk builds a hut and makes it improper, he commits a serious transgression.🔽If he builds it in a disputed area, he commits a serious transgression.

original: brtsam du mi rung ba byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtsam du mi rung ba byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it in an unsuitable place, he commits a serious transgression.

original: ma bstan par byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bstan par byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it without being invited to do so, he commits a serious transgression.

original: tshad las 'das par byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad las 'das par byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If he builds it beyond the right size, he commits a serious transgression.

original: thams cad las 'das par byed du 'jud na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad las 'das par byed du 'jud na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one causes all of them to be transgressed, it is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhud 'dir thams cad du brtsal ba nyid ces bya ba'i yan lag lhag par yod de /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhud 'dir thams cad du brtsal ba nyid ces bya ba'i yan lag lhag par yod de /
translated: In this treatise, the analysis, there is always the additional factor of “seeking.”

original: des na sbom por gsungs so //
analyzed: des na sbom por gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be serious.

original: gang la btsal ba nyid ces bya ba'i yan lag med la /
analyzed: gang la btsal ba nyid ces bya ba'i yan lag med la /
translated: If there is no additional factor of “seeking,”

original: tshad las lhag pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshad las lhag pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: and it is not beyond the proper size,

original: mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag nyi tshe yod pa de la ni nyes byas so /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag nyi tshe yod pa de la ni nyes byas so / // / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: and there is only the partial factor of unsuitability, and so on, then it is a minor offense.

original: bskos pa nyid dang ma bskos pa nyid dag ni gtso bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bskos pa nyid dang ma bskos pa nyid dag ni gtso bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The factors of appointed and not appointed are not primary.

original: bskos pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis byed du 'jud pa nyid do //
analyzed: bskos pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis byed du 'jud pa nyid do //
translated: “ Appointed” means causing another to do it.

original: ma bskos pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gis byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma bskos pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gis byed pa nyid do //
translated: “ Not appointed” means doing it oneself.

original: de gnyis ni gtso bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni gtso bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Those two are not primary.

original: ltung ba @181a * //
analyzed: ltung ba @181a * //
translated: The downfall is not a serious one.

original: las gtso cher gzhag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: las gtso cher gzhag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the principal factor is not the basis.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: dge slong bskos pa'i dbang gis khang ba'am gtsug lag khang byed du 'jud pa la yang rang dgar byed du 'jud pa'i ltung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bskos pa'i dbang gis khang ba'am gtsug lag khang byed du 'jud pa la yang rang dgar byed du 'jud pa'i ltung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When a monk, by virtue of his appointment, has a house or a temple built, the form of the transgression is the same as the form of the transgression of one who has it built at will.

original: bskos pa na rang nyid dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni bskos pas byas pa ni sko bar byed pa rang nyid kyis byas pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bskos pa na rang nyid dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni bskos pas byas pa ni sko bar byed pa rang nyid kyis byas pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: When appointed, it is the same as if he did it himself.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽ji ltar bdag nyid kyis khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dag log pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur pa de bzhin du bskos pas log pa nyid du sgrub par byed na yang sko bar byed pa nyid la kha na ma
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / ji ltar bdag nyid kyis khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dag log pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur pa de bzhin du bskos pas log pa nyid du sgrub par byed na yang sko bar byed pa nyid la kha na ma
translated: This is what is taught:🔽Just as there is an offense for one who himself builds a house or temple in the wrong place, so too there is an offense for one who builds in the wrong place when appointed.

original: tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is the same as if the one who appoints did it himself.

original: mdo snga mas ni bskos pa'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa byas so //
analyzed: mdo snga mas ni bskos pa'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa byas so //
translated: The former sūtra establishes the transgression of one who is appointed.

original: 'dis ni sko bar byed pa'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa byas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sko bar byed pa'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa byas so //
translated: This passage presents the downfall of being a delegator.

original: de'i phyir bskos pas gad byed pa de ni sko bar byed pa nyid kyis byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskos pas gad byed pa de ni sko bar byed pa nyid kyis byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the one who is delegated to do the work is made to do it by the delegator.

original: bskos pas ni rang nyid dang 'dra'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: bskos pas ni rang nyid dang 'dra'o zhes smras na /
translated: If the one who is delegated to do the work is like the delegator himself,

original: gal te sko bar byed pas ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du bskos pas de bzhin du mi byed na ci bskos pa de sgo bar byed pa rang nyid dang 'dra'am snyam du dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te sko bar byed pas ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du bskos pas de bzhin du mi byed na ci bskos pa de sgo bar byed pa rang nyid dang 'dra'am snyam du dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: then if the one who is delegated does not do the work as instructed by the delegator, is the one who is delegated like the delegator himself?

original: ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du mi byed pa la lus dang ngag gis nod na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad bsgo ba bzhin du mi byed pa la lus dang ngag gis nod na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to address this doubt, the text says, “If he does not do as instructed, he is made to do it by body and speech.”

original: sgo bar byed pa'i tshig las 'das te /
analyzed: sgo bar byed pa'i tshig las 'das te /
translated: He is made to do it by body and speech because he has transgressed the words of the delegator.

original: gzhan du byed pa ni ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa'o //🔽ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa bskos pa rang gis byas pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan du byed pa ni ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa'o // ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa bskos pa rang gis byas pa'am /
translated: To do otherwise is to not do as instructed.

original: gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa de la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa de la /
translated: If the one who is delegated does not do as instructed, he is made to do it by himself or by having others do it.

original: gal te sko bar byed pas lus kyis so phag sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / ngag gis legs par byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa de nod pa dang du len par byed khas len par byed na de'i tshe bskos pas byed pa de sgo bar byed pa rang nyid kyis byed pa dang 'dra🔽bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sko bar byed pas lus kyis so phag sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / ngag gis legs par byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bsgo ba bzhin mi byed pa de nod pa dang du len par byed khas len par byed na de'i tshe bskos pas byed pa de sgo bar byed pa rang nyid kyis byed pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If the one who is appointed does not act in accordance with the order, such as giving a brick with the body or saying “well done” with speech, and if the one who is ordered accepts, agrees, and takes up the order, then at that time the one who is appointed should be known as similar to the one who is ordering.

original: 'dir gzhung na gal te de la 'di skad ces legs par byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung na gal te de la 'di skad ces legs par byas so //
translated: Here, the treatise says: “If the one who is appointed says to the one who is ordering, ‘Well done!

original: shin tu byas so //
analyzed: shin tu byas so //
translated: Very well done!

original: ngas khyod la 'di ltar bsgo'o zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: ngas khyod la 'di ltar bsgo'o zhes zer zhing /
translated: I will act in accordance with your order,’

original: de de la shing ngam tsa'am sa 'jim dag 'bul bar byed de /
analyzed: de de la shing ngam tsa'am sa 'jim dag 'bul bar byed de /
translated: and if the one who is ordering offers wood, clay, or earth to the one who is appointed,

original: gang mi rung ba byed du 'jud na gnyi ga la yang gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽byas pa ni gcig nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang mi rung ba byed du 'jud na gnyi ga la yang gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // byas pa ni gcig nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: then if the one who is appointed does something improper, both will incur a downfall according to the basis.”

original: byas pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byas pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is appointed is the same as the one who is ordering.

original: gnas rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir las kyi bya ba byas pa'o //🔽de ni dus yun ring thung du mas bar du chod du zin kyang ltung ba rnam @181b par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: gnas rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir las kyi bya ba byas pa'o // de ni dus yun ring thung du mas bar du chod du zin kyang ltung ba rnam @181b par gzhag pa la /
translated: The action is the performance of the deed in order to establish the basis.

original: gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Even if a long or short period of time intervenes, the downfall is still considered to be one.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dus kyis bar du chod pa lo la sogs pa'i tshad dag gis gnas shing yang rtsom par byed du zin na yang de lta mod kyi rtsom pa de dag thams cad ni gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: dus kyis bar du chod pa lo la sogs pa'i tshad dag gis gnas shing yang rtsom par byed du zin na yang de lta mod kyi rtsom pa de dag thams cad ni gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Even if one resumes the action after a long or short period of time, such as a year, all those actions are considered to be one downfall.

original: ltung ba gcig byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ltung ba gcig byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the downfall is committed only once.

original: mi ltos pas btang ba ni gzhan yin te /
analyzed: mi ltos pas btang ba ni gzhan yin te /
translated: The downfall that is relinquished by not relying on the basis is different.

original: mi ltos pas bar du ye btang ba las phyis yang bsam pa gzhan gyis rtsom pa la ni ltung ba tha dad do //
analyzed: mi ltos pas bar du ye btang ba las phyis yang bsam pa gzhan gyis rtsom pa la ni ltung ba tha dad do //
translated: If one relinquishes the basis for a long time and then resumes the action with a different intention, the downfall is different.

original: 'phro zin par byed na nyes ba sbom por 'gyur ro ma zin par rang bzhin gzhan gyis rjes su sgrub pa la ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phro zin par byed na nyes ba sbom por 'gyur ro ma zin par rang bzhin gzhan gyis rjes su sgrub pa la ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one resumes the action, it is said that one commits a serious violation. If one resumes the action with a different nature, it is said that one commits an offense.

original: rjes su sgrub pa gcig kho na yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rjes su sgrub pa gcig kho na yin du zin kyang /
translated: Later, even if the practice is the same,

original: dper na 'thab pa'i mod la dang / 'thab pa'i 'og tu sdums byed pa la sogs pa'i tshigs dag la ltung ba tha dad par byas pa bzhin du /🔽ci 'dir yang rung ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yan lag dag la ltung ba tha dad par bya'am snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'thab pa'i mod la dang / 'thab pa'i 'og tu sdums byed pa la sogs pa'i tshigs dag la ltung ba tha dad par byas pa bzhin du / ci 'dir yang rung ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yan lag dag la ltung ba tha dad par bya'am snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: for example, it is like the different downfalls in the context of fighting, after fighting, making peace, and so on.🔽Here, one might think that the branches of unseemly action and so on are different downfalls.

original: yan lag rnams ni byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To dispel that doubt, it is said that the branches are not different agents.

original: rung pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa yan lag rnams ni ltung ba'i phyir byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rung pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa yan lag rnams ni ltung ba'i phyir byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The branches of unseemly action and so on are not different agents for the sake of downfalls.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: rung ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa yan lag ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi ltung ba dag 'dir 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa yan lag ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi ltung ba dag 'dir 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The downfalls that occur here are not as numerous as the branches of unseemly action and so on.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it?

original: ltung ba gcig kho nar zad de /
analyzed: ltung ba gcig kho nar zad de /
translated: There is only one downfall.

original: yan lag rnams ni ltung ba'i byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni ltung ba'i byed pa po tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the limbs are not different agents of the downfall.

original: gang la khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: With regard to what is it a saṃsthāpana offense?

original: btsal ba la'o //🔽des rjes su gnang ba la'o //
analyzed: btsal ba la'o // des rjes su gnang ba la'o //
translated: With regard to searching.🔽With regard to the one who approves it.

original: rnam pa de lta bus so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus so //
translated: In that way.

original: gzhi ma dag pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhi ma dag pa la'o //
translated: With regard to an impure basis.

original: ma bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: ma bstan pa la'o //
translated: With regard to one who is not a monk.

original: gnas byed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: gnas byed du bcug na'o //
translated: When one has made him stay.

original: mthar ro zhes bya ba dag smas te /🔽btsal ba la'o zhes bya ba ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: mthar ro zhes bya ba dag smas te / btsal ba la'o zhes bya ba ni gzhi ste /
translated: At the end.🔽With regard to searching means with regard to the basis.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sa gzhi brjod de /
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sa gzhi brjod de /
translated: The word basis refers to the ground.

original: gal te gzhi de chos 'di la rab tu byung ba las kyang btsal na'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhi de chos 'di la rab tu byung ba las kyang btsal na'o //
translated: If one searches for the ground for this Dharma, even if one is a renunciate.

original: sus btsal zhe na /
analyzed: sus btsal zhe na /
translated: Who searches?

original: de ni 'dir skabs yin pas ltung ba 'byin pa pos zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir skabs yin pas ltung ba 'byin pa pos zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since this is the context here, it should be understood that it is the one who commits the downfall.

original: des rjes su gnang ba la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des rjes su gnang ba la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to the one who approves it means

original: dge slong gang gis sa gzhi btsal bar gyur pa des gal te rjes su gnang pa'i gzhi la'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang gis sa gzhi btsal bar gyur pa des gal te rjes su gnang pa'i gzhi la'o //
translated: if the monk who searches for the ground approves it.

original: rnam pa de lta bus so zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa ste /🔽gnas rjes su bsgrub par bya ba'i yo byad shing dang so @182a * //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus so zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa ste / gnas rjes su bsgrub par bya ba'i yo byad shing dang so @182a * //
translated: The phrase “in that way” is the proof.

original: phag dang mi glas dang / gla rngan la sogs pas so //
analyzed: phag dang mi glas dang / gla rngan la sogs pas so //
translated: The requisites for establishing a site are wood, bricks, people to do the work, wages, and so on.🔽How is the proof expressed in the phrase “in that way”?

original: ji ltar na sgrub par byed pa de rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod ce na gang gi phyir ji ltar ltung ba 'byin pa po'am /🔽ltung ba 'byin pa pos rjes su gnang ba sa /
analyzed: ji ltar na sgrub par byed pa de rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod ce na gang gi phyir ji ltar ltung ba 'byin pa po'am / ltung ba 'byin pa pos rjes su gnang ba sa /
translated: Because the one who establishes the site or the one who directs the establishment of the site🔽allows the use of any kind of material for the site, whether pure or impure, as long as it is not prohibited.

original: gzhi'i rnam pa gang zhig btsal ba'i rnam pa des gzhi ma dag pa dang / ma bstan par gnas byad du bcug pa de ltar gal te sgrub par bye pa shing dang so phag dang mi glas dang / gla rngan la sogs pa 'di yang ltung ba 'byin pa po'am /
analyzed: gzhi'i rnam pa gang zhig btsal ba'i rnam pa des gzhi ma dag pa dang / ma bstan par gnas byad du bcug pa de ltar gal te sgrub par bye pa shing dang so phag dang mi glas dang / gla rngan la sogs pa 'di yang ltung ba 'byin pa po'am /
translated: If the one who establishes the site, or the one who directs the establishment of the site,🔽allows the use of any kind of material for the site, whether pure or impure, as long as it is not prohibited, then the requisites for establishing the site, such as wood, bricks, people to do the work, wages, and so on, are also allowed.

original: ltung ba 'byin pa bos rjes su gnang ba'i slong ba pos btsal ba yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar sa gzhi btsal ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pa 'di yang btsal ba yin pas de'i phyir btsal bar mtshungs pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa la yang rnam pa
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa bos rjes su gnang ba'i slong ba pos btsal ba yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar sa gzhi btsal ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pa 'di yang btsal ba yin pas de'i phyir btsal bar mtshungs pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa la yang rnam pa
translated: Therefore, since the one who searches for the alms and the one who establishes the monastery are the same, the one who establishes the monastery is also the one who searches for the alms.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: The term “such” is stated.

original: sgrub par byed pa rnam pa de lta bus gnas byed du bcug na ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa rnam pa de lta bus gnas byed du bcug na ste /
translated: If the one who establishes the monastery is the one who searches for the alms,🔽then the one who searches for the alms is the one who establishes the monastery.

original: btsal bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btsal bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as searching for the alms.

original: btsal ba nyid 'di la lung 'di dag kyang snang ste /
analyzed: btsal ba nyid 'di la lung 'di dag kyang snang ste /
translated: These scriptures also appear in this very search for the alms.

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
translated: In the Upāliparipṛcchā it says:

original: la las 'di skad ces ci tsam gyis na rang gis btsal ba'i khang pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: la las 'di skad ces ci tsam gyis na rang gis btsal ba'i khang pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Some say, “To what extent is it called a self-searched house?”

original: gang las gnyis yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang las gnyis yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is that from which two things are accomplished.

original: yo byad dang sa gzhi'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de nyid las gzhung 'di skad du gang zag gi gzhir byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad dang sa gzhi'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de nyid las gzhung 'di skad du gang zag gi gzhir byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And in that same text, it says, “If one makes someone else do the work of preparing the site, one commits a serious violation.”

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang rang gis btsal ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang rang gis btsal ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: And in the Sutra of Individual Liberation, it says, “One should search for oneself.”

original: gzhi ma dag pa la'o zhes bya ba ni mi dung ba nyid dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / brtsam du mi rung ba nyid ni ma dag pa'o zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhi ma dag pa la'o zhes bya ba ni mi dung ba nyid dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / brtsam du mi rung ba nyid ni ma dag pa'o zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: “On an impure site” means “on a site that is not pure,” and the text below explains that a site is not pure if it is not agreeable, if it is the cause of disputes, or if it is not suitable for building.

original: ma bstan pa la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bstan pa la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Without having been assigned” means

original: dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa nyid ni bstan pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid kyang 'og nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa nyid ni bstan pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid kyang 'og nas 'byung ste /
translated: that the site has not been assigned by the Sangha. The text below explains that a site has been assigned if it has been designated by the Sangha.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma bstan pa nyid do //
translated: A site that is the opposite of one that has been assigned is one that has not been assigned.

original: gnas byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one has someone else do the work of preparing the site” means

original: khang ba byed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: khang ba byed du bcug na'o //
translated: if one has someone else do the work of building a hut.

original: mthang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one has it built” means

original: zin na ste /
analyzed: zin na ste /
translated: if one has it built and then uses it.

original: gnas kyi ngo bo ni thog bkab cing sgom gtogs pa kun nas bskor ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas kyi ngo bo ni thog bkab cing sgom gtogs pa kun nas bskor ba nyid do //
translated: The nature of the site is that it is covered above and surrounded on all sides by a wall.

original: de zin pa'i skad cig ma la ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de zin pa'i skad cig ma la ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moment it is completed, it becomes a pārājika offense.

original: sngar ni sbom por ro //
analyzed: sngar ni sbom por ro //
translated: Previously, it was a sthūlātyaya offense.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te gzhi de ltung ba 'byin pa pos btsal ba'am /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gal te gzhi de ltung ba 'byin pa pos btsal ba'am /
translated: This is taught:🔽If the site is approved by the one who commits the downfall,

original: de nyid kyis btsal ba'i phyir rjes su gnang ba yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis btsal ba'i phyir rjes su gnang ba yin la /
translated: or if it is approved by the one who searches for it,

original: sgrub @182b par byed pa yang btsal ba de nyid du rjes su gnang ba yin zhing /
analyzed: sgrub @182b par byed pa yang btsal ba de nyid du rjes su gnang ba yin zhing /
translated: and if the construction is approved in the very place that was searched,

original: gzhi ma dag pa rung ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs par sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: gzhi ma dag pa rung ba nyid ma yin pa la sogs par sgrub par byed pa /
translated: and if the site is not pure, not suitable, and so on,

original: shing dang so phag dang / mi glas dang / gla rngan bcal bas gnas byed du bcug na zin pa'i skad cig ma la dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing dang so phag dang / mi glas dang / gla rngan bcal bas gnas byed du bcug na zin pa'i skad cig ma la dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if the construction is done by hiring carpenters, bricklayers, and laborers, and paying them wages, then the moment it is completed, it becomes a root downfall.

original: sngar ni sbom phor ro //
analyzed: sngar ni sbom phor ro //
translated: Previously, it was a sthūlātyaya offense.

original: gang la gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is a root downfall for the saṅgha of a monastery?

original: de'i phyir / 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de ma btsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de ma btsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Those very same are for the lower, but not if not sought.”🔽In the context of the house, there is no fault in not being a vessel for the four modes of conduct.

original: khang ba'i skabs su spyod lam bzhi'i snod ma yin pa nyid la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag bstan pa de dag nyid thams cad gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma la yang blta bar bya ste der ni ma
analyzed: khang ba'i skabs su spyod lam bzhi'i snod ma yin pa nyid la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag bstan pa de dag nyid thams cad gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma la yang blta bar bya ste der ni ma
translated: Those very same that are taught should be seen for all the bases of training in the temple below, but there it is not🔽sought.

original: btsal ba nyid de btsal ba nyid ma gtogs so //
analyzed: btsal ba nyid de btsal ba nyid ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for seeking,

analyzed: btsal ba nyid ma gtogs na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: except for seeking, this meaning of the words occurs here.

original: gnas pa bdag nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: gnas pa bdag nyid kyis sam /
translated: Either by oneself or

analyzed: rjes su gnang ba'i sa gzhir sgrub par byed pa rang gi'am rjes su gnang bas gzhi ma dag par bstan pa'i gtsug lag khang byed du bcug na gtsug lag khang zin pa'i mthar dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: by one who is permitted, if one causes a temple to be made on a site that is not purified by one’s own or permitted means, then at the end of the completion of the temple, there is a saṃghātiśeṣa offense.

original: sngar ni sbom por ro //
analyzed: sngar ni sbom por ro //
translated: Previously, it was a sthūlātyaya.

original: gtsug lag las ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis bdag po dang bcas pa zhes bya ba smos par zad kyi /
analyzed: gtsug lag las ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis bdag po dang bcas pa zhes bya ba smos par zad kyi /
translated: In the scriptures, it is said that the basis is “endowed with an owner” due to the context of the story.

original: de yan lag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not a branch of the offense.

original: bdag po med pa nyid la yang sa gzhi nyo ba la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po med pa nyid la yang sa gzhi nyo ba la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible to buy land and so on even without an owner.

original: dge 'dun gyis gzhir byed du 'jud na yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gzhir byed du 'jud na yang de bzhin no //
translated: And if the Saṅgha is made the basis, it is the same.

original: khang ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma la yan lag gzhan gnyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khang ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma la yan lag gzhan gnyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the Saṅgha-kīlaya saṃgraha-vastūni, two other branches should be mentioned:

original: gcig gi don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig gi don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For the sake of one person” means

original: gang zag gcig gi don du 'jud na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang zag gcig gi don du 'jud na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi /
translated: if one engages in building for the sake of one person, it is a saṃghātiśeṣa offense.

analyzed: gnyis dang mang po dag gi don du na sbom por 'gyur ro //

translated: Here, in some texts of the Upāliparipṛcchā, it is said that if one engages in building for the sake of a group of two, there is a sthūlātyaya offense.

original: zhu ba las gnyis zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba las gnyis zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The statement “two” in the question is an illustration.

original: mang po'i don du byed du 'jud na yang sbom po kho na'o //
analyzed: mang po'i don du byed du 'jud na yang sbom po kho na'o //
translated: If one causes many to engage in the act, it is only a serious offense.

analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid gcig pu'am dge slong gzhan gcig gam khyim pa gcig gi don du byed du bcug na dge 'dun lhag ma ste /
translated: Therefore, if one causes a single person, oneself, another fully ordained monk, or a layperson to engage in the act, it is a partial defeat.

analyzed: gcig gi don du'o zhes bya ba gcig gi sgra bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term “single” is not specified, it is said to be for the sake of a single person.🔽If one causes all to engage in the act, does it become that?

analyzed: @183a * // ci nas byed du bcug pa thams cad las der 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
