translated: and if one were to urinate or defecate in those places, one would have the fault of being unsuitable because one’s life would be short.

original: de la phyi rol ces bya ba ni gnas kyi ra ba'i phyi rol nas so //
analyzed: de la phyi rol ces bya ba ni gnas kyi ra ba'i phyi rol nas so //
translated: “Outside” means outside the boundary of the monastery.

original: 'dom gang zhes bya ba ni khru bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dom gang zhes bya ba ni khru bzhi'o //
translated: “One fathom” means four cubits.

original: 'dom gang gi mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi mtshams so //🔽de'i nyen kor zhes bya ba ni de dang nye ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'dom gang gi mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi mtshams so // de'i nyen kor zhes bya ba ni de dang nye ba nyid de /
translated: “The edge of one fathom” means the limit of one fathom.🔽“Its vicinity” means just that vicinity.

original: de'i nyen kor te 'dom gang gi mtha' dang nye ba pha mtha'i cha'o //
analyzed: de'i nyen kor te 'dom gang gi mtha' dang nye ba pha mtha'i cha'o //
translated: “The vicinity of that, the edge of one fathom” is the limit of that.

original: de'i nang rol ces bya ba ni pha mtha'i cha de nas tshu rol te ;
analyzed: de'i nang rol ces bya ba ni pha mtha'i cha de nas tshu rol te ;
translated: “Inside that” means from that limit, this side.

original: 'dom gang gi nang nyid do //
analyzed: 'dom gang gi nang nyid do //
translated: It is one fathom in size.

original: nang rol de'i dbus sam mtha'i phyogs gang yang rung ba de na chu klung la sogs pa gang yang rung ba cig dang 'dom par gyur na yang der de yun thung du gnas par 'gyur bas brtsam du mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: nang rol de'i dbus sam mtha'i phyogs gang yang rung ba de na chu klung la sogs pa gang yang rung ba cig dang 'dom par gyur na yang der de yun thung du gnas par 'gyur bas brtsam du mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: If a river or something else were to enter the middle or edge of that space, then it would not be suitable, because it would remain there for a short time.

original: phyogs thams cad du khor khor yug kun du chu klung la sogs pa thams cad dang 'dom pa kho na la ni mi bsnyegs so //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du khor khor yug kun du chu klung la sogs pa thams cad dang 'dom pa kho na la ni mi bsnyegs so //
translated: It is not possible for a river or anything else to enter everywhere around the entire perimeter of that space.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dom gang gi mtha'i nyen kor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dom gang gi mtha'i nyen kor brtag par bya ste /
translated: Here, the text says, “The perimeter of one fathom should be examined.”

original: gal te gzhi chu klung la brten tam ngam grog la brten pa yin na brtsam du mi rung ba'i phyir bstan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhi chu klung la brten tam ngam grog la brten pa yin na brtsam du mi rung ba'i phyir bstan par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the foundation is based on a river or a ravine, it should not be indicated because it is not suitable.

original: gang las 'das na gnas tshad las lhag par 'gyur ba'i tshad de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las 'das na gnas tshad las lhag par 'gyur ba'i tshad de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the measure beyond which it becomes exceeding the prescribed size?

original: de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ste nang rol nas de bcu gnyis dang bdun gyi tshad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ste nang rol nas de bcu gnyis dang bdun gyi tshad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, a cubit of proper measure is one-half of a Sugata-span, and twelve of those and seven of those are the measurements of the interior.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgres pa'i sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang ngo //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgres pa'i sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru gang ngo //
translated: Twenty-four finger-widths, which are calculated in terms of the sequence of atoms and so on, are one cubit of proper measure.

original: khru de'i phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ngo //
analyzed: khru de'i phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ngo //
translated: One-half of that cubit is one-half of a Sugata-span.🔽Twelve of those Sugata-spans and seven of those Sugata-spans are the measurements of the interior of that house.

original: khang pa de'i nang rol nas chur sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i tshad las khru gang du brtsis pa'i khru de'i phyed dang do la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad yin pa'i bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho de @184a * //
analyzed: khang pa de'i nang rol nas chur sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i tshad las khru gang du brtsis pa'i khru de'i phyed dang do la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad yin pa'i bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho de @184a * //
translated: The interior of that house is twenty-four finger-widths in height, and one cubit is calculated as one finger-width.🔽One-half of that cubit is one-half of a Sugata-span.

original: bcu gnyis dang zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho de bdun ni 'dir khang pa de'i tshad yin par blta'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis dang zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho de bdun ni 'dir khang pa de'i tshad yin par blta'o //
translated: Twelve of those Sugata-spans and seven of those Sugata-spans are the measurements of the interior of that house.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma bstan pa nyid do zhes smras na bstan pa nyid de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma bstan pa nyid do zhes smras na bstan pa nyid de gang zhe na /
translated: If one says that the opposite of that is not revealed, then what is revealed?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the basis of obtaining the teaching from the Saṅgha is revealed.

original: gzhi gang la bstan pa thob pa de ni bstan pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi gang la bstan pa thob pa de ni bstan pa thob pa ste /
translated: That basis on which the teaching is obtained is the basis of obtaining the teaching.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: Its state is just that.

original: gang las thob ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang las thob ce na de'i phyir /
translated: From what is it obtained? Therefore, it is said:

original: dge 'dun las zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge 'dun las zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: From the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa'i gzhi de ni bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun las bstan pa thob pa'i gzhi de ni bstan pa nyid do //
translated: That basis of obtaining the teaching from the Saṅgha is revealed.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: khang pa'i sa gzhi'i gzhi de'i gnang ba'i las ni /
analyzed: khang pa'i sa gzhi'i gzhi de'i gnang ba'i las ni /
translated: The action of permission on that basis of the ground of the house is:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khang pa'i gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma ma chis pa brtsam du rung ba zhig btsal te /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khang pa'i gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma ma chis pa brtsam du rung ba zhig btsal te /
translated: This monk named such-and-such has sought out a suitable site for a house, one that is free from disputes and ready to begin.

original: dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las khang pa'i gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma mchis pa brtsam du rung ba bstan pa gsol na /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las khang pa'i gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma mchis pa brtsam du rung ba bstan pa gsol na /
translated: If the Saṅgha approves of the monk named so-and-so requesting a site for a hut that is suitable, free from disputes, and fit to build on, then the Saṅgha should grant its approval.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyis dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyis dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la /
translated: The Saṅgha is granting the monk named so-and-so a site for a hut that is suitable, free from disputes, and fit to build on.

original: khang pa'i gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma mchis pa brtsam du rung ba bstan pa stsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gtsug lag khang gi gzhi la yang de bzhin du sbyar ba'i gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyi tshig gang yin pa de ni de'i bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: khang pa'i gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma mchis pa brtsam du rung ba bstan pa stsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gtsug lag khang gi gzhi la yang de bzhin du sbyar ba'i gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyi tshig gang yin pa de ni de'i bstan pa yin te /
translated: The announcement and the two-part formal procedure that are the announcement and the two-part formal procedure for requesting a site for a temple are the announcement and the two-part formal procedure for that.

original: gzhi gang la bstan pa rnam pa de nyid gang las thob pa de ni 'dir bstan pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhi gang la bstan pa rnam pa de nyid gang las thob pa de ni 'dir bstan pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: The site on which the announcement is made and from which it is obtained is what is meant by the announcement here.

original: ma dag pa gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma dag pa gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not request an unsuitable site.

original: gzhi mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma dag pa dge 'dun las bstan pa gsol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma dag pa dge 'dun las bstan pa gsol bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not request the teaching of the basis from an impure Saṅgha that possesses unsuitability and so forth.

original: rang dag rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang dag rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: One should go to the pure ones to investigate the basis.

original: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, the appointed monks.

original: dge slong des dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gang dag la gzhi bstan pa gsol ba'i dge slong de dag rang dag gzhi 'di'i dag pa nyid rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gang dag la gzhi bstan pa gsol ba'i dge slong de dag rang dag gzhi 'di'i dag pa nyid rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: The monks who are the Saṅgha should go to investigate the purity of that basis themselves.

original: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag rtog tu gtang bar bya'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag rtog tu gtang bar bya'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, the appointed monks should be sent to investigate, not others.

original: stan la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te dge slong lo drug tshun chad du stan bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stan la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni / gal te dge slong lo drug tshun chad du stan bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The same applies to seats.🔽If a monk requests permission from the Saṅgha to make a seat within six years,

original: dge @184b 'dun las gnang ba gsol bar byed na /
analyzed: dge @184b 'dun las gnang ba gsol bar byed na /
translated: in order to make a seat,

original: stan de la yang rnyings pa nyid brtag pa'i phyir gang dag la gsol ba'i dge slong de dag rang nyid rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: stan de la yang rnyings pa nyid brtag pa'i phyir gang dag la gsol ba'i dge slong de dag rang nyid rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: the monks who are requested should go to investigate that seat themselves in order to examine its wear.

original: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag rtog tu gtang bar bya'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag rtog tu gtang bar bya'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, it is to send a monk who has been appointed, not another.

original: byas pa rnyed pa dang / byas pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni ltung nga med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byas pa rnyed pa dang / byas pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni ltung nga med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if one obtains what was made by another, or if one uses what was made by another.

original: gnas gzhan gyis byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas zin pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyis byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas zin pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one obtains what was made by another monastery, or if one uses what was made by another.🔽There is also no offense if one repairs an old one.

original: rnying pa 'chos pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs par byed do //
analyzed: rnying pa 'chos pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs par byed do //
translated: The word “also” is to be supplied.

original: gnas rnying pa 'chos shing byi dor byed ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnas rnying pa 'chos shing byi dor byed ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one repairs and cleans an old dwelling.

original: rnying pa 'chos pa zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: rnying pa 'chos pa zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: “Repairs an old one” is an example.

original: sar pa 'chos shing byi dor byed pa la yang ltung ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sar pa 'chos shing byi dor byed pa la yang ltung ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: There is no offense if one repairs and cleans a new one.

original: khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba de rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba de rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The remaining schisms of the saṅgha of a monastery are finished.

original: // / gang byas na gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang byas na gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done to create a schism of the saṅgha of a monastery?

original: 'dir sngar 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de ma btsal ba'o zhes smos pa'i rnam pa nyid khas blangs nas bye brag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sngar 'og ma la yang de dag nyid de ma btsal ba'o zhes smos pa'i rnam pa nyid khas blangs nas bye brag brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the same as above, “they are not sought” is accepted and the distinctions are stated.

original: tshogs kyi don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of a gathering

original: 'dir khyim pa yan chad rab tu byung ba dang / rab tu ma byung ba la yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dir khyim pa yan chad rab tu byung ba dang / rab tu ma byung ba la yang rung ste /
translated: Here, whether a layperson or a renunciate, whether ordained or not ordained,

original: gang zag bzhi yan chad la tshogs zhes bya bar dongs so //
analyzed: gang zag bzhi yan chad la tshogs zhes bya bar dongs so //
translated: four or more persons are called a gathering.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no zhes gsungs pa de ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no zhes gsungs pa de ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis te /
translated: The Exposition declares, “For the sake of a gathering” means “the saṅgha of śrāvakas of the Tathāgata.” That is stated from the perspective of the nidāna.

original: dpe tsam du zad bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dpe tsam du zad bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: Since it is merely an example, there is no fault here.

original: gtsug lag khang la ni tshad nges par med do //🔽gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'i zhes bya ba de rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la ni tshad nges par med do // gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'i zhes bya ba de rnam par 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: There is no fixed size for a temple.🔽The chapter on the Saṃghabhedavastu is finished.

original: // / dge 'dun lhag ma de gnyi ga'i skabs zhu ba las gsungs pa ni 'dra bas /
analyzed: // / dge 'dun lhag ma de gnyi ga'i skabs zhu ba las gsungs pa ni 'dra bas /
translated: The two chapters on the Saṅghāvaśeṣa offenses are similar in their explanations,

original: skabs gcig kho nas bsdu ba'i phyir /🔽rtsom pa ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skabs gcig kho nas bsdu ba'i phyir / rtsom pa ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: so they are combined in a single chapter.🔽The beginning is the preparation.

original: gnas rtsom pa ni sbyor ba nyid de /
analyzed: gnas rtsom pa ni sbyor ba nyid de /
translated: The beginning of the action is the preparation.

original: spom po'i dbang du byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spom po'i dbang du byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is from the perspective of the gross.

original: de yang gang la mthar dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de la ni sbyor ba la sbom po'o //
analyzed: de yang gang la mthar dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de la ni sbyor ba la sbom po'o //
translated: Moreover, if the final step becomes the actual basis, then the preparation is gross.

original: gang la mthar sbom por 'gyur ba de la ni sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang la mthar sbom por 'gyur ba de la ni sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the final step becomes gross, then the preparation is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni brtsams nas @185a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni brtsams nas @185a * //
translated: Here, the text says that if one begins the act

original: bdag nyid gsod par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gsod par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and then kills oneself, there is a gross offense.

original: ma g-yogs pa byed du 'jud pa'i mthar yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de khang pa'am gtsug lag khang steng ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du gzhug go snyam pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa'i dge slong gi gnas de'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang de dang 'dra ste
analyzed: ma g-yogs pa byed du 'jud pa'i mthar yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de khang pa'am gtsug lag khang steng ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du gzhug go snyam pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa'i dge slong gi gnas de'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang de dang 'dra ste
translated: The end of that place of the monk who has entered with the thought “I will cause a house or a temple to be built uncovered” is the same as that.

original: / sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: / sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be viewed as similar to the preparatory act.

original: sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: a serious offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma g-yogs pa zhig byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says: “If one causes an uncovered one to be built, there is a serious offense.”

original: sngar ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: sngar ni nyes byas so //
translated: Previously it was a minor offense.

original: du ma'i don du'o zhes bya ba ni khang pa mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag thams cad las 'das pa du ma'i don du byed du bcug pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: du ma'i don du'o zhes bya ba ni khang pa mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yan lag thams cad las 'das pa du ma'i don du byed du bcug pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of many means: the end of causing to be built for the sake of many who have transgressed all the branches such as unsuitability of the house, etc., should be viewed as similar to the preparatory act.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gnyis kyi spyi la byed du 'jud na nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gnyis kyi spyi la byed du 'jud na nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, if one makes the general rule that the text refers to both, then the fault is serious.

original: ma bskos par ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bskos par ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If not appointed,

original: ma bskos pa zhes bya ba ni tshol ba po'am gnas pa pos rjes su ma gnang bar byed du 'jud pa ste /
analyzed: ma bskos pa zhes bya ba ni tshol ba po'am gnas pa pos rjes su ma gnang bar byed du 'jud pa ste /
translated: not appointed means if one makes someone do it without the approval of the seeker or the resident.

original: de'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mtha' gang yin pa de yang sbyor ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever the limit of that is, it should be seen as similar to the application.

original: dngos po tshang na yang pham par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po tshang na yang pham par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the substance is complete, there is no defeat.

original: gzhi de gang dbang ba de nyid kyi phyir gtsug lag khang rtsig tu 'jud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi de gang dbang ba de nyid kyi phyir gtsug lag khang rtsig tu 'jud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is for the purpose of building a monastery for the one who owns that basis.

original: dngos gzhir yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos gzhir yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It also does not become the actual basis.

original: btsal ba'i yan lag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsal ba'i yan lag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no branch of seeking.

original: de bas na rjes su gnang ba la yang yan lag thams cad chad na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su gnang ba la yang yan lag thams cad chad na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, if all the branches are severed even in the case of approval, it is the actual basis.

original: rjes su ma gnang pa la ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: rjes su ma gnang pa la ni sbom po'o //
translated: If not approved, it is serious.

original: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las ma bskos par byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las ma bskos par byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the scripture states that if one causes another to do it without being appointed, there is a grave offense.

original: gang zag gis so zhes bya ba ni gis so zhes bstan pa'i phyir sngar rnam pa de lta bus so zhes bya bas sgrub par byed pa bstan pa'i bye brag yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis so zhes bya ba ni gis so zhes bstan pa'i phyir sngar rnam pa de lta bus so zhes bya bas sgrub par byed pa bstan pa'i bye brag yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase by a person indicates that the agent is the person who is appointed. Therefore, one should understand that the phrase in such a way indicates the specific means of accomplishing the act.

original: de'i phyir gang zag gi sgrub par byed pas byed du 'jud na de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag gi sgrub par byed pas byed du 'jud na de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Therefore, if one causes another person to do it, it is similar.

original: sbyor ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste btsal pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste btsal pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be understood to be like the preparatory act, because there is no search for a companion.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang zag gi gzhis byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang zag gi gzhis byed du 'jud na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the scripture states that if one causes another to do it on one's behalf, there is a grave offense.

original: zhu ba'i skabs 'di thams cad khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhi gnyi ga'i dbang du byas par @185b rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhu ba'i skabs 'di thams cad khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhi gnyi ga'i dbang du byas par @185b rig par bya ste /
translated: All these sections on requesting should be understood to apply to both the training rules on houses and temples.

original: gang zag gis so zhes bya ba 'di 'ba' zhig ma gtogs te /
analyzed: gang zag gis so zhes bya ba 'di 'ba' zhig ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for the phrase “by a person,”

original: gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhil btsal ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi bslab pa'i gzhil btsal ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the branch “searching for the basis of training in a temple” is not set forth.

original: 'phro zin par byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phro zin par byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one causes it to be finished,

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni byed du 'jud na mtha' de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni byed du 'jud na mtha' de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the word “also” is used because it is a continuation of the phrase “if it is the same.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'phro zin par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'phro zin par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “If one causes it to be finished, there is a serious violation.”

original: gsol ba'i 'og tu ma grub na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol ba'i 'og tu ma grub na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not completed after requesting, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bdag po las gzhi btsal pa gsol ba dang / dge 'dun las rung ba bstan pa gsol ba'i 'og tu gnas te por ma grub pa na nyes byas te /
analyzed: bdag po las gzhi btsal pa gsol ba dang / dge 'dun las rung ba bstan pa gsol ba'i 'og tu gnas te por ma grub pa na nyes byas te /
translated: If it is not completed at the beginning, after requesting the basis from the owner and requesting the teaching of suitability from the saṅgha, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhi yang btsal zin la gsol ba dang las brjod pa yang byas pa'i 'og tu gnas byed du bcug pa'i dus na te por ma grub pa gang yin pa de las nyes byas su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi yang btsal zin la gsol ba dang las brjod pa yang byas pa'i 'og tu gnas byed du bcug pa'i dus na te por ma grub pa gang yin pa de las nyes byas su shes par bya'o //
translated: And when the site has been sought, and the announcement and the formal procedure have been done, and the site has been approved, then whatever is not done is to be understood as a wrong action.

original: mi 'dod pa'i bsam pas ma grub pa la 'di rnam par gzhag gi bar chad kyi dbang gis ma grub pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i bsam pas ma grub pa la 'di rnam par gzhag gi bar chad kyi dbang gis ma grub pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: This is established when it is not done with the intention of not doing it, not when it is not done because of an obstacle.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig gzhi btsal nas mi bgyid na ltung bcir 'gyur nyes byas su'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig gzhi btsal nas mi bgyid na ltung bcir 'gyur nyes byas su'o //
translated: Here the text says, “Venerable, if one does not do it after seeking the site, is there an offense?” “There is a wrong action.”

original: khang pa bstan pa gsol nas bgyid du mi gsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khang pa bstan pa gsol nas bgyid du mi gsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If one does not do it after asking for the announcement of the site, is there an offense?” “There is a wrong action.”

original: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma zhu ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba de gnyis zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma zhu ba'i skabs so zhes bya ba de gnyis zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so //
translated: The section on the remainder of the Saṃgha and the request for a vihāra and a temple is finished.

original: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma gnyis so zhes bya ba de gnyis bshad zin to /
analyzed: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma gnyis so zhes bya ba de gnyis bshad zin to /
translated: The two remaining offenses entailing relinquishment are the house and the temple.

original: // / gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: The remaining offenses entailing relinquishment that are denigrations without basis are now described.

original: pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pas dge slong nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pas dge slong nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The monk who engages in the defeat of engaging in sexual intercourse and so on is also degenerate.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa pham par 'gyur ba lhag mar spyod pa kun du spyod pas skur pa 'debs pa la ni pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa pham par 'gyur ba lhag mar spyod pa kun du spyod pas skur pa 'debs pa la ni pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pa ste /
translated: The denigrator who engages in the defeat of engaging in sexual intercourse and so on is one who engages in the defeat of engaging in sexual intercourse and so on.

original: pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pa des skur pa 'de bas na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba lhag par spyod pa des skur pa 'de bas na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: Since he denigrates through engaging in the defeat, it is a remaining offense entailing relinquishment.

original: su la lhag par spyod pa des skur pa 'debs na zhe na /
analyzed: su la lhag par spyod pa des skur pa 'debs na zhe na /
translated: With regard to whom does he denigrate?

original: de'i phyir dge slong la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “the monk.”

original: dge tshul la sogs pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pa la ma yin no //
translated: He does not denigrate novices and so on.

original: nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The monk who engages in the defeat of engaging in sexual intercourse and so on is also degenerate.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa @186a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa @186a * //
translated: The monk who possesses ethical conduct is not degenerate.

original: 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi /
translated: not only to the pure.

original: nyams pa la skur pa btab na yang ngo //
analyzed: nyams pa la skur pa btab na yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one accuses one who has degenerated.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas pa ma nyams pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma nyid kyis dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir nyams pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas pa ma nyams pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma nyid kyis dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir nyams pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The words “also one who has degenerated” are stated to show that the exception is a fully ordained monk who has not degenerated, and a nun.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: dge slong nyams pa la yang pham par 'gyur bas skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong nyams pa la yang pham par 'gyur bas skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accuses a fully ordained monk who has degenerated, and he becomes guilty of a defeating offense, then it is a serious offense for the Saṅgha.

original: ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i gzhung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i gzhung ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the text for accusing one who is impure:

original: gang zag ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs par byed na ltung pa gzhi bcu gcig dang / ltung ba med pa'i gzhi drug ste /
analyzed: gang zag ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs par byed na ltung pa gzhi bcu gcig dang / ltung ba med pa'i gzhi drug ste /
translated: If one accuses an impure person, there are eleven bases for downfalls and six bases for no downfall.

original: ltung ba'i gzhi bcu gcig las ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba'i gzhi bcu gcig las ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it from among the eleven bases for downfalls?

original: des ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / mi dogs pa dang / 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas na ji snyed brjod do cog la dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: des ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / mi dogs pa dang / 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas na ji snyed brjod do cog la dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: If he has no sight, no hearing, no suspicion, and he has a changed perception, then whatever he says is a serious offense for the Saṅgha.

original: zhu ba las kyang btsun pa dge slong rang 'di skad ces bdag gis mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bstan to zhes mchi ba de la dge slong gis gzhi ma mchis par rku ba'am /
analyzed: zhu ba las kyang btsun pa dge slong rang 'di skad ces bdag gis mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bstan to zhes mchi ba de la dge slong gis gzhi ma mchis par rku ba'am /
translated: and the Buddha replied, “Venerable, if a monk says, ‘I have engaged in sexual intercourse,’ then if a monk accuses him without grounds of stealing,

original: 'gums pa'am / smra bas skur pa 'debs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gums pa'am / smra bas skur pa 'debs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: killing or lying, what is his offense?”

original: dge 'dun lhag mar ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.”🔽In general, the Sūtra on the Essence of Discipline declares:

original: spyir bstan pa'i mdo las rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ni mtshan dang khas len pas bzung ngo zhes 'byung ba de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyir bstan pa'i mdo las rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ni mtshan dang khas len pas bzung ngo zhes 'byung ba de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who are in agreement with one’s own faction are determined by their marks and by their assertions.🔽In order to teach the exceptions to that,

original: phyogs las rang nyid ni 'dir yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyogs las rang nyid ni 'dir yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “Here, one’s own faction is not a branch.”

original: mtshan gyi dbang dang lta ba khas len pa'i dbang gis phyogs las rang nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa dge slong rnams dang / dge slong rnams su dge slong ma rnams dang dge slong ma rnams su khas len pa rnams dang / khas len pa rnams su khas mi len pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mtshan gyi dbang dang lta ba khas len pa'i dbang gis phyogs las rang nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa dge slong rnams dang / dge slong rnams su dge slong ma rnams dang dge slong ma rnams su khas len pa rnams dang / khas len pa rnams su khas mi len pa rnams dang /
translated: Those who are called those who accept by the power of the name and the power of accepting the view are those who accept.🔽Those who are called those who do not accept by the power of the name and the power of not accepting the view are those who do not accept.🔽Those who are called those who are not by the power of the name and the power of not accepting the view are those who are not.

original: khas mi len pa rnams su phyogs las rang nyid do zhes bya ba de ni skur ba 'debs pa'i skabs 'dir khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: khas mi len pa rnams su phyogs las rang nyid do zhes bya ba de ni skur ba 'debs pa'i skabs 'dir khas mi blang ngo //
translated: This is not accepted in this context of slander.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Then how?

original: mtshan mi mthun pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / lta ba mi mthun pa la skur pa 'debs pa yang dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / lta ba mi mthun pa la skur pa 'debs pa yang dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Slander with discordant names and slander with discordant views is a partial victory of the Saṅgha.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las dge slong gis dge slong ma la gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las dge slong gis dge slong ma la gzhi med par pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: Here the text is: If a monk slanders a nun with a non-existent defeating offense, it is a partial victory of the Saṅgha.

original: de bzhin du dge slong mas dge slong la gzhi med @186b pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽de bzhin du khas len pa la khas mi len pa dang / khas mi len pa la khas len pas gzhi med pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs pa yang dge 'dun lhag ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong mas dge slong la gzhi med @186b pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa'o // de bzhin du khas len pa la khas mi len pa dang / khas mi len pa la khas len pas gzhi med pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa 'debs pa yang dge 'dun lhag ma ste /
translated: So too, if a fully ordained nun groundlessly charges a fully ordained monk with having committed an offense entailing defeat, she commits a serious offense.🔽So too, if one does not accept a charge but the other does, or if one accepts a charge but the other does not, and if one groundlessly charges the other with having committed an offense entailing defeat, one commits a serious offense.

original: nyams pa la skur pa 'debs pa la yang kha na mtho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa las na khas len pa dang / khas mi len pa gnyis la skur pa 'debs pa lta ba la shin tu kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /🔽pham par ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa la skur pa 'debs pa la yang kha na mtho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa las na khas len pa dang / khas mi len pa gnyis la skur pa 'debs pa lta ba la shin tu kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te / pham par ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one charges one who has lapsed, then one commits a complete offense.

original: mtshan mi mthun pa la yang nyams pa dang 'dra ba'i kha na ma tho pha kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa la yang nyams pa dang 'dra ba'i kha na ma tho pha kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one charges one who does not have the same attributes, then one commits a complete offense that is similar to the offense of one who has lapsed.

original: ci yang dag pas sam 'on te yang dag pa ma yin pas she na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci yang dag pas sam 'on te yang dag pa ma yin pas she na de'i phyir /
translated: One may ask, Is it by means of what is true or by means of what is not true?

original: brdzun du smra bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, by means of false speech.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa 'debs na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one deprecates by means of what is not true, then it is a pārājika offense for the Saṅgha.

original: yang dag pas ni ma yin pa ste ;
analyzed: yang dag pas ni ma yin pa ste ;
translated: But if it is by means of what is true,

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa'i gzhi rnams med par yang dag pa ma yin par brjod na'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa'i gzhi rnams med par yang dag pa ma yin par brjod na'o //
translated: then it is a pārājika offense for the Saṅgha if one speaks what is not true with regard to the bases of what is seen, heard, or suspected.

original: ci skur pa gdab phar bya ba nyid nye bar gyur pa kho na la'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci skur pa gdab phar bya ba nyid nye bar gyur pa kho na la'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: One may ask, Is it only when the act of deprecation is actually being done?

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba la go bar byas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba la go bar byas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, it is not. Therefore, it is said, if one makes it understood to anyone at all.

original: mi'i 'gro ba pa gang yang rung ba la go bar byas brda phrad par byas na yang dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba pa gang yang rung ba la go bar byas brda phrad par byas na yang dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one makes it understood, makes it known, to any human being at all, then it is a pārājika offense for the Saṅgha.

original: glengs pa 'ba' zhig gis der 'gyur par ma zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: glengs pa 'ba' zhig gis der 'gyur par ma zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not only when one is directly accused that it becomes a pārājika offense.

original: ci bsam pa gang yang rung bas mi gang yang rung ba la go bar byas na 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsam pa gang yang rung bas mi gang yang rung ba la go bar byas na 'am zhe na /
translated: If one causes another person to understand anything at all with any intention,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then no.

original: de'i phyir nyams pas 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams pas 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “by one who is degenerate, with a desire.”

original: nyams par bya ba bskyed pa'i bsam pas yin gyi /🔽khros par gyur pa'am /🔽rgod bag gam /
analyzed: nyams par bya ba bskyed pa'i bsam pas yin gyi / khros par gyur pa'am / rgod bag gam /
translated: It is with the intention to generate a downfall,🔽not with anger,🔽or with levity,

original: byung rgyal gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byung rgyal gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: or with recklessness.

original: 'di ltar ltung bas nyams par bya ba'i bsam pas brdzun gyis pha rol po la glengs sam gzhan la go bar bya ba'i phyir brda sprod bar byed pa na der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ltung bas nyams par bya ba'i bsam pas brdzun gyis pha rol po la glengs sam gzhan la go bar bya ba'i phyir brda sprod bar byed pa na der 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one causes another to understand with the intention to generate a downfall, then it is a downfall.

original: de la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /🔽pham par 'gyur bas skur na ni dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te / pham par 'gyur bas skur na ni dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: The presentation of downfalls is as follows:

original: dge 'dun lhag mas skur na ltung byed do //🔽ltung ba gzhan gyis skur na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mas skur na ltung byed do // ltung ba gzhan gyis skur na nyes byas so //
translated: If one accuses another of a defeating offense, it is a serious transgression of the monastic community.🔽If one accuses another of a serious transgression of the monastic community, it is a downfall that requires confession without forfeiture.🔽If one accuses another of another downfall, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nyes byas kyis skur na nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas kyis skur na nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accuses another of an offense of wrong conduct, it is a minor offense of wrong conduct.

original: @187a * // the tshom dang bcas pas skur na yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: @187a * // the tshom dang bcas pas skur na yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o //
translated: If one accuses with doubt, the doubt is like the perception.

original: de ni gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a different basis.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa'i gzhi la bsnyegs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa'i gzhi la bsnyegs so //
translated: The word “it” refers to the seen, heard, and suspected bases.

original: gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang la mthong ba de ni thos pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni / gang la mthong ba de ni thos pa ma yin /
translated: “It is not a different basis” means

original: dogs pa yang ma yin la /🔽gang thos pa de mthong ba ma yin dogs pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dogs pa yang ma yin la / gang thos pa de mthong ba ma yin dogs pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: that which is seen is not heard or suspected,🔽and that which is heard is not seen or suspected,

original: gang dogs pa de mthong ba yang ma yin thos pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dogs pa de mthong ba yang ma yin thos pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o //

original: 'dir gzhung ni thos pa la yid ches nas bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / thos pa la yid ma ches par bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / thos pa la dogs pan bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / thos pa na mi dogs pa na bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang /

translated: when one says, “I see,” having doubts about what one has heard,🔽when one says, “I see,” without doubts about what one has heard,

original: dogs pa la dogs pa na bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba na /
analyzed: dogs pa la dogs pa na bdag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ba na /
translated: and when one says, “I see,” having doubts about doubts,

original: brjod do cog dge 'du na lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽brjed pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dran pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod do cog dge 'du na lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // brjed pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dran pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: all of these are said to be the remainder.🔽“Forgetfulness does not exist” means that forgetfulness does not exist.

analyzed: mi dran pa'i dngos po brjed pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa smras pa yin no //
translated: The thing called forgetfulness is said to be unreal.

original: 'dir gzhung ni des mthong la de yang brjed bzhin du 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pas bdag gis mthong ro zhes zer ba dang / des thos la de yang brjed bzhin du 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pa bdag gis thos so zhes zer ba dang /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni des mthong la de yang brjed bzhin du 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pas bdag gis mthong ro zhes zer ba dang / des thos la de yang brjed bzhin du 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pa bdag gis thos so zhes zer ba dang /
translated: Here the treatise mentions:

original: de dogs la de yang brjed bzhin du 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pas bdag dogs so zhes zer na brjod do cog dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dogs la de yang brjed bzhin du 'du shes bsgyur ba dang bcas pas bdag dogs so zhes zer na brjod do cog dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one sees something, but having forgotten it, one transforms one’s discernment and says, “I saw it,” or if one hears something, but having forgotten it, one transforms one’s discernment and says, “I heard it,” or if one smells something, but having forgotten it, one transforms one’s discernment and says, “I smelled it,” then all of these are saṅgha schisms.

original: ci'i phyir na gang dngos su de bzhin yin yang gzhi gzhan la gzhi nyid ces mi bya zhing brjed pa yang yod pa nyid ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /🔽don gyi de nyid ni mi brdzun par smra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na gang dngos su de bzhin yin yang gzhi gzhan la gzhi nyid ces mi bya zhing brjed pa yang yod pa nyid ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir / don gyi de nyid ni mi brdzun par smra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Why is it that even though something is actually like that, it is not called the basis of that and it is not forgotten?🔽To dispel such doubts, the treatise states:🔽The reality of the meaning is not the cause of speaking untruth.

original: don gyi de nyid ni mi brdzun par smra ba bden par smra pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyi de nyid ni mi brdzun par smra ba bden par smra pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: The reality of the meaning is not the cause of speaking untruth, of speaking truly.

original: 'di ltar 'du shes ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du shes ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, perception is the cause.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gal te dge slong 'du shes sgyur bar byed na don gyi de nyid yod @187b du zin kyang de brdzun du smra ba nyid yin pas dge 'dun lhag ma kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dge slong 'du shes sgyur bar byed na don gyi de nyid yod @187b du zin kyang de brdzun du smra ba nyid yin pas dge 'dun lhag ma kho nar 'gyur ro //

original: de ni gzhi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / brjed pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo de gnyis ni nyams pa'i yul la ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs pa la dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i khungs yin la /

original: dper na ma ning pho lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ma ning pho lta bu'o //

original: de gnyis kyis skur pa 'debs na nyes byas so //🔽bsams te smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhogs smos byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis skur pa 'debs na nyes byas so // bsams te smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhogs smos byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one accuses them, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one accuses by saying, “I said this intentionally,” and so on, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bsams te smras so zhes rnam pa de lta bus gzhogs smos byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsams te smras so zhes rnam pa de lta bus gzhogs smos byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one accuses by saying, “I said this intentionally,” there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gzhan gyi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gzhan gyi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here the term “and so on” indicates other forms.

original: zhu ba las dge slong stan las langs te bdag gis bsams te smras so zhes zer zhing skye bo thams cad las nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhu ba las dge slong stan las langs te bdag gis bsams te smras so zhes zer zhing skye bo thams cad las nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bye ba lta bu'o //
translated: If one is asked, “Did you say this intentionally?” and the bhikṣu stands up from his seat and says, “I said it intentionally,” there is an offense of wrong conduct for all people.

original: bag tsam la'ang rnam pa de dag shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bag tsam la'ang rnam pa de dag shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand these forms even for slight offenses.

original: bdag gis dge slong ma che ge mo zhes bya ba ma ning pho dang mi tshangs par sbyor pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dge slong ma che ge mo zhes bya ba ma ning pho dang mi tshangs par sbyor pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, “I saw a certain bhikṣuṇī who is a paṇḍaka engaging in sexual intercourse, the act of copulation,” and so on.

original: gzhi med pa dang bag tsam gyi zhu ba'o zhes bya ba de gnyis zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzhi med pa dang bag tsam gyi zhu ba'o zhes bya ba de gnyis zhu ba'i skabs nas 'byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The two, “without basis” and “a mere hint,” occur in the section on requests.

original: // / da ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par 'dod nas de'i zhar la 'di @189a * //
analyzed: // / da ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma brjod par 'dod nas de'i zhar la 'di @189a * //
translated: Now, wanting to explain the remainder of the defeating offense of causing a schism in the saṅgha, this is said as an aside.

original: brjod do // gzhan gyi 'khor kha 'dren na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod do // gzhan gyi 'khor kha 'dren na sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one leads away the retinue of another, it is a serious violation.”

original: gzhan gyi 'khor ni gzhan gyi 'khor te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khor ni gzhan gyi 'khor te /
translated: The retinue of another is the retinue of another.

original: de kha 'dren pa ni bdag nyid kyi phyogs su kha 'dren zhing gzhog pa ste /
analyzed: de kha 'dren pa ni bdag nyid kyi phyogs su kha 'dren zhing gzhog pa ste /
translated: Leading it away is leading it to one’s own side and making it one’s own.

original: de ni spom po'o //
analyzed: de ni spom po'o //
translated: That is a serious violation.

original: 'di man chad ni bzlog pa'i tshul gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la sogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bsgo ba las 'byung ba bzhi po dag gi thun mong gi rnam pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni bzlog pa'i tshul gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la sogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bsgo ba las 'byung ba bzhi po dag gi thun mong gi rnam pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: From here on, the common aspects of the four that occur in the explanation of the remainder of the defeating offense of causing a schism in the saṅgha and so on are to be explained by “the method of reversal,” and so on.

original: bzlog pa'i tshul gyis mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni rjes su mthun no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i tshul gyis mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni rjes su mthun no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of the practice that is not given up by the method of reversal is “in accordance with.”

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo me bde ba dag bzlog pa'i tshul gyis bzlog pa ni mi gtong mi spong bar de rjes su sgrub pa bya ba rtsom par mi byed cing mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin rnam pa lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo me bde ba dag bzlog pa'i tshul gyis bzlog pa ni mi gtong mi spong bar de rjes su sgrub pa bya ba rtsom par mi byed cing mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin rnam pa lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig
translated: The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.

original: byed du gyur pa gang yin pa'am cang mi smra ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa gang yin pa'am /🔽gnyi gar gyur pa gang yin pa ste /🔽bzlog pa'i tshul gyis mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin de ni gsol ba zhes bya ba ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su mthun te /
analyzed: byed du gyur pa gang yin pa'am cang mi smra ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa gang yin pa'am / gnyi gar gyur pa gang yin pa ste / bzlog pa'i tshul gyis mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin de ni gsol ba zhes bya ba ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su mthun te /
translated: The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.🔽The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.🔽The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.🔽The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.🔽The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.🔽The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.🔽The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang 'dra ba dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang 'dra ba dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal is the nature of the one who does not give up but practices in accordance with the reversal.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The

original: gang gi phyir dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi po de dag bzlog pa dang / 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir bzlog pa ji snyed byed pa ltung ba yang de snyed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi po de dag bzlog pa dang / 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir bzlog pa ji snyed byed pa ltung ba yang de snyed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those four remaining offenses of the Saṅgha are related to the reversal, therefore, as many reversals as there are, there are that many downfalls.

original: de'i phyir mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin de ni bzlog pa'i tshul gyis rjes su mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin de ni bzlog pa'i tshul gyis rjes su mthun pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of not relinquishing and subsequently practicing is consistent with the method of reversal.

original: bzlog pa gcig la mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin yang gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa gcig la mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i rang bzhin yang gcig kho na'o //
translated: For one reversal, the nature of not relinquishing and subsequently practicing is exactly the same.

original: bzlog pa sbyor bar gyur pa la ni ltung ba yang sbyor bar gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzlog pa sbyor bar gyur pa la ni ltung ba yang sbyor bar gyur pa nyid do //
translated: For one who has engaged in reversal, the downfall is also engaged.

original: thar thug par gyur pa la ni dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: thar thug par gyur pa la ni dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gyur pa nyid do //
translated: For one who has reached the end, the ultimate of the remaining offenses of the Saṅgha is reached.

original: gsol ba ni bzlog pa dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol ba ni bzlog pa dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The request is exactly like the reversal.

original: bzlog par bya ba nyid la ni dge 'dun la gsol ba go bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni dngos su bzlog pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba nyid la ni dge 'dun la gsol ba go bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni dngos su bzlog pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: In the very act of reversal, whatever is to be understood as a request to the Saṅgha is not actually the reversal itself.

original: bzlog pa'i thabs gang yin pas de'i phyir 'dra ba nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i thabs gang yin pas de'i phyir 'dra ba nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: The method of reversal is taught to be similar to that.

original: ji ltar las brjod pa dag mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin pa @189b bzhin du gsol ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar las brjod pa dag mi gtong bar rjes su sgrub pa'i ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin pa @189b bzhin du gsol ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the one who does not relinquish the recitation of the confession of faults is the agent of the downfall, so too is the one who does not relinquish the recitation of the request.

original: bzlog pa dang 'dra bar gyur pas na bzlog pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa dang 'dra bar gyur pas na bzlog pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since the reversal is similar to that, it is the reversal.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That entity is that itself.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sbyor bar gyur pa la yang ltung bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sbyor bar gyur pa la yang ltung bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, here too, the one who engages in the recitation incurs the downfall.🔽The one who recites the words is the agent of the downfall.

original: gsol ba'i tshig ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no zhes smras pa la tshig de yang cha shas du ma yod na /
analyzed: gsol ba'i tshig ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no zhes smras pa la tshig de yang cha shas du ma yod na /
translated: If those words have many parts,🔽how many downfalls are there?

original: ci cha shas ji snyed yod pa de snyed kho na'i ltung bar 'gyur ram snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci cha shas ji snyed yod pa de snyed kho na'i ltung bar 'gyur ram snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel that doubt,

original: tshig gi skad cig ma gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshig gi skad cig ma gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that it is just one moment of the word.

original: tshig gang la skad cig ma gcig la ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig ma de'i khongs su tshig mtha' dag 'dus so //
analyzed: tshig gang la skad cig ma gcig la ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig ma de'i khongs su tshig mtha' dag 'dus so //
translated: All words are included in the moment when a moment of a word occurs that is the basis for a downfall.

original: des na shin tu rgyun ring du zin na yang tshig gcig tu zad de /
analyzed: des na shin tu rgyun ring du zin na yang tshig gcig tu zad de /
translated: Therefore, even if it is a very long continuum, it is just one word.

original: ltung ba yang gcig kho na 'byung ba yin gyi /🔽cha shas re re la yang ma yin /
analyzed: ltung ba yang gcig kho na 'byung ba yin gyi / cha shas re re la yang ma yin /
translated: Also, there is just one downfall.

original: rtsa ba re re la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba re re la yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is a downfall for each part or for each root.

original: skad cig ma gang la tshe dang ldan pa lha sbyin khyod dge 'dun dbye bar byed pa'i dngos po 'di lta bu thong shig ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa na tshig phal cher byas pa nyid yin pas de ni 'dir dngos gzhi'i dus yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gang la tshe dang ldan pa lha sbyin khyod dge 'dun dbye bar byed pa'i dngos po 'di lta bu thong shig ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa na tshig phal cher byas pa nyid yin pas de ni 'dir dngos gzhi'i dus yin te /
translated: When the elder monk Devadatta was told, “Venerable Devadatta, give up this action of dividing the saṅgha,” and so on, he had already committed most of the words. Therefore, this is the time of the actual basis.

original: gsol pa dang / la rjod pa'i dus de gnyis ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin gyis /🔽dus phyi ma gzhan ni rtsom pa gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsol pa dang / la rjod pa'i dus de gnyis ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin gyis / dus phyi ma gzhan ni rtsom pa gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The two times of requesting and of replying are the actual basis for the downfall.

original: de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: The later times are included in that because they are part of the same action.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gsol ba byed pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gsol ba byed pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
translated: If the basis is relinquished when the request is made, then that is good.

original: gal te mi gtong na las brjod pa byas pa na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na las brjod pa byas pa na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But if it is not relinquished, then when the rite is performed, a serious offense is incurred.

original: bzlas pa rnams kyang gcig tu dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa rnams kyang gcig tu dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The recitations are distinct, in order to dispel doubt that the serious offense is incurred just by the request.

original: bzlas pa ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bzlas pa ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The recitations are distinct, he said.

original: las brjod pa rnams kyi bzlas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: las brjod pa rnams kyi bzlas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The recitations of the rite are distinct,

original: yang dang yang du bzlas pa rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bzlas pa rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the recitation is repeated again and again.

original: de ltar na las brjod pa lan re re la ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na las brjod pa lan re re la ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, a downfall is incurred for each recitation of the rite.
